definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

label: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production
definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 (CCL17) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

label: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 19 production
definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 19 (CCL19) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

label: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production
definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 (CCL20) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

label: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 21 production
definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 21 (CCL21) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 (CCL22) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 (CXCL13) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 (CXCL16) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

definition: The appearance of macrophage inflammatory protein 1 alpha due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

definition: The appearance of macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

definition: The appearance of monocyte chemotactic protein-1 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

definition: A biological process where T cells produce GM-CSF resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: interferon-alpha production
definition: The appearance of interferon-alpha due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

label: epitope specific interferon-beta production by T cells
definition: A process of interferon-beta production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific IFN-g release by T cells
definition: A biological process where T cells produce IFNg resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells
definition: A process of interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific IL-1b release by T cells
definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-1b resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: interleukin-1 alpha production
definition: The appearance of interleukin-1 alpha due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

label: interleukin-1 beta production
definition: The appearance of interleukin-1 beta due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

label: epitope specific IL-10 release by T cells
definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-10 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific IL-12 release by T cells
definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-12 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-13 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

definition: A process of interleukin-15 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific interleukin-16 production by T cells
definition: A process of interleukin-16 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: interleukin-17A production
definition: The appearance of interleukin-17A due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

label: interleukin-17F production
definition: The appearance of interleukin-17F due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

label: epitope specific IL-17 release by T cells
definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-17 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific IL-18 release by T cells
definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-18 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific IL-2 release by T cells
definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-2 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

definition: A process of interleukin-21 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

definition: A process of interleukin-23 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

definition: A process of interleukin-27 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

definition: A process of interleukin-3 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific IL-4 release by T cells
definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-4 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-5 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific IL-6 release by T cells
definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-6 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific interleukin-7 production by T cells
definition: A process of interleukin-7 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

definition: A process of interleukin-8 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific interleukin-9 production by T cells
definition: A process of interleukin-9 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific TNF release by T cells
definition: A biological process where T cells produce TNF resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific lymphotoxin A production by T cells
definition: A process of lymphotoxin A production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells
definition: A process of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: helper T cell enhancement of B cell mediated immune response
definition: Positive regulation of a B cell mediated immune response mediated via cytokine production by a helper T cell.

label: helper T cell enhancement of T cell mediated immune response
definition: Positive regulation of a T cell mediated immune response mediated via cytokine production by a helper T cell.

label: epitope specific helper T cell enhancement of T cell mediated immune response
definition: A process of helper T cell enhancement of T cell mediated immune response resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific T cell enhancement of B cell mediated immune response
definition: A process of T cell enhancement of B cell mediated immune response resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific granzyme A production by T cells
definition: A process of granzyme A production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific perforin production by T cells
definition: The production of perforin, an immune mediator molecule involved in T cell degranulation,  resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific granulysin production by T cells
definition: A process of granulysin production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: regulation of DNA methylation
definition: Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of the covalent transfer of a methyl group to either N-6 of adenine or C-5 or N-4 of cytosine.

label: regulation of gene expression, epigenetic
definition: Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of gene expression; the process is mitotically or meiotically heritable, or is stably self-propagated in the cytoplasm of a resting cell, and does not entail a change in DNA sequence.

label: epitope specific T cell proliferation
definition: A biological process where T cells proliferate resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific T cell activation
definition: A process of T cell activation resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: mitochondrion
definition: A semiautonomous, self replicating organelle that occurs in varying numbers, shapes, and sizes in the cytoplasm of virtually all eukaryotic cells. It is notably the site of tissue respiration.

label: DNA polymerase complex
definition: A protein complex that possesses DNA polymerase activity and is involved in template directed synthesis of DNA.

label: MHC protein complex
definition: A transmembrane protein complex composed of an MHC alpha chain and, in most cases, either an MHC class II beta chain or an invariant beta2-microglobin chain, and with or without a bound peptide, lipid, or polysaccharide antigen.

label: immunoglobulin complex
definition: A protein complex that in its canonical form is composed of two identical immunoglobulin heavy chains and two identical immunoglobulin light chains, held together by disulfide bonds and sometimes complexed with additional proteins. An immunoglobulin complex may be embedded in the plasma membrane or present in the extracellular space, in mucosal areas or other tissues, or circulating in the blood or lymph.

label: adaptive immune receptor
definition: is a receptor produced by cells of the adaptive immune system with the purpose of binding epitopes.

label: epitope specific cytotoxic T cell degranulation
definition: A process of cytotoxic T cell degranulation resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: cellular response to DNA damage stimulus
definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus indicating damage to its DNA from environmental insults or errors during metabolism.

label: immune response
definition: Any immune system process that functions in the calibrated response of an organism to a potential internal or invasive threat.

label: epitope specific transforming growth factor-beta production by T cells
definition: A process of transforming growth factor-beta production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells
definition: A process of monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 production by T cells
definition: A process of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells
definition: A process of macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production by T cells
definition: A process of macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific RANTES production by T cells
definition: A process of RANTES production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 production by T cells
definition: A process of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells
definition: A process of granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific IP-10 production by T cells
definition: A process of IP-10 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific granzyme B production by T cells
definition: A process of granzyme B production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production by T cells
definition: A process of tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: lymphotoxin A production
definition: The appearance of lymphotoxin A due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

label: tumor necrosis factor (ligand) superfamily member 11 production
definition: The appearance of tumor necrosis factor superfamily member 11 (TNFSF11; RANKL) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

label: tumor necrosis factor production
definition: The appearance of tumor necrosis factor due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

label: epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells
definition: A process of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific tumor necrosis factor (ligand) superfamily member 11 production by T cells
definition: A process of tumor necrosis factor (ligand) superfamily member 11 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific interleukin-17A production by T cells
definition: A process of interleukin-17A production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific interleukin-17F production by T cells
definition: A process of interleukin-17F production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: B cell epitope specific complement-dependent cytotoxicity
definition: complement-dependent cytotoxicity resulting from antibody binding to epitope

label: B cell epitope specific histamine secretion mediated by immunoglobulin
definition: histamine secretion mediated by immunoglobulin resulting from antibody binding to epitope

label: B cell epitope specific immune complex formation
definition: immune complex formation resulting from antibody binding to epitope

label: B cell epitope specific immunoglobulin-mediated neutralization
definition: immunoglobulin-mediated neutralization resulting from antibody binding to epitope

label: epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 19 production by T cells
definition: A process of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 19 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 21 production by T cells
definition: A process of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 21 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 12 production by T cells
definition: A process of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 12 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 production by T cells
definition: A process of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 production by T cells
definition: A process of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.

label: adverse event trigger
definition: revisit?

label: rule
definition: a rule is an executable which guides, defines, restricts actions

label: time trigger
definition: revisit?

label: concentration unit
definition: A unit which represents a standard measurement of how much of a given substance there is mixed with another substance.

label: frequency unit
definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the number of repetitive actions in a particular time.

label: length unit
definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the distance between two points.

label: mass unit
definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of matter/energy of a physical object.

label: pressure unit
definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the force applied to a given area.

label: rate unit
definition: A unit which represents a standard measurement occurrence of a process per unit time.

label: substance unit
definition: A unit which is a standardised quantity of an element or compound with uniform composition.

label: temperature unit
definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the average kinetic energy of the particles in a sample of matter.

label: time unit
definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the dimension in which events occur in sequence.

label: volume unit
definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of space occupied by any substance, whether solid, liquid, or gas.

label: volumetric flow rate unit
definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the volume of fluid which passes through a given surface per unit time .

label: decision-theoretic analysis objective
definition: An objective specification which what includes a description of two or more alternative actions to take in a particular situation and a metric that enables comparisons of the two actions. The objective specified is achieved in a planned process which includes a data transformation, the output of which is an identification of the 'best' choice according to the metric.

label: material maintenance objective
definition: An objective specification maintains some or all of the qualities of a material over time.

label: service provision objective
definition: An objective which is fulfilled by the provision of some service e.g. a training service

label: specimen collection objective
definition: A objective specification to obtain a material entity for potential use as an input during an investigation.

label: training objective
definition: An objective specification which is fulfilled by the provision of some training.

label: assay objective
definition: an objective specification to determine a specified type of information about an evaluated entity (the material entity bearing evaluant role)

label: assay validation objective
definition: an objective specification to check the accuracy or the quality of the results of an assay by comparison with independent results

label: biological feature identification objective
definition: Biological_feature_identification_objective is an objective role carried out by the proposition defining the aim of a study designed to examine or characterize a particular biological feature.

label: data transformation objective
definition: An objective specification to transformation input data into output data

label: material transformation objective
definition: an objective specifiction that creates an specific output object from input materials.

label: methodology testing objective
definition: Methodology_testing_objective is an objective role carried out by a proposition defining the aim of the study is to examine the effect of using different methodologies.

label: selective organism creation objective
definition: an objective specification to generate a population or type of organism within species that have some uniform behavioral, morphological, physiological, or genetic characteristics with similarly bred organisms.

label: specification of data to be generated in an investigation
definition: An objective specification which indicates the type of data that will be generated and submitted to a database.

label: categorical label
definition: A label that is part of a categorical datum and that indicates the value of the data item on the categorical scale.

label: measurement unit label
definition: A measurement unit label is as a label that is part of a scalar measurement datum and denotes a unit of measure.

label: GenePattern software
definition: a software that provides access to more than 100 tools for gene expression analysis, proteomics, SNP analysis and common data processing tasks.

label: software application
definition: A software application is software that can be directly executed by some processing unit.

label: software library
definition: A software library is software composed of a collection of software modules and/or software methods in a form that can be statically or dynamically linked to some software application.

label: software method
definition: A software method (also called subroutine, subprogram, procedure, method, function, or routine) is software designed to execute a specific task.

label: software module
definition: A software module is software composed of a collection of software methods.

label: software script
definition: A software script is software whose instructions can be executed using a software  interpreter.

label: binding datum
definition: A data item that states if two or more material entities have the disposition to form a complex, and if so, how strong that disposition is.

label: diagnosis
definition: The representation of a conclusion of a diagnostic process.

label: genome coverage
definition: A data item that is the total number of bases in reads, divided by genome size, assumed to be the reference size (for instance of 3.10 Gb for human and 2.73 Gb for mouse) and refers to the percentage of the genome that is contained in the assembly based on size estimates; these are usually based on cytological techniques. Genome coverage of 90–95% is generally considered to be good, as most genomes contain a considerable fraction of repetitive regions that are difficult to sequence. So it is not a cause for concern if the genome coverage of an assembly is a bit less than 100%.

label: average value
definition: A  data item that is produced as the output of an averaging data transformation and represents the average value of the input data.

label: cartesian spatial coordinate datum
definition: A cartesian spatial coordinate datum is a representation of a point in a spatial region, in which equal changes in the magnitude of a coordinate value denote length qualities with the same magnitude

label: center value
definition: A data item that is produced as the output of a center calculation data transformation and represents the center value of the input data.

label: data about an ontology part
definition: data about an ontology part is a data item about a part of an ontology, for example a term

label: data set
definition: A data item that is an aggregate of other data items of the same type that have something in common. Averages and distributions can be determined for data sets.

label: date process started
definition: A data item that is the date when a process was initiated.

label: genetic characteristics information
definition: a data item that is about genetic material including polymorphisms, disease alleles, and haplotypes.

label: measurement datum
definition: A measurement datum is an information content entity that is a recording of the output of a measurement such as produced by a device.

label: number of PCR cycles during library construction
definition: A data item that is the number of PCR cycles used during the construction of a sequencing library.

label: number of errors
definition: a data item that is the number of times that a given process failed, as an integer

label: number of rounds of amplification
definition: A data item that is the number of times an amplification reaction happened.

label: operational taxonomic unit matrix
definition: Operational Taxonomic Unit matrix  is a data item, organized as a table, where organismal taxonomic units, computed by sequence analysis and genetic distance calculation, are counted in a set of biological or environmental samples. The table is  used to appraise biodiversity of a population or community of living organism.

label: predicted data item
definition: A data item that was generated on the basis of a calculation or logical reasoning

label: quantitative confidence value
definition: A data item which is used to indicate the degree of uncertainty about a measurement.

label: setting datum
definition: A settings datum is a datum that denotes some configuration of an instrument.

label: spike-in dilution factor
definition: A data item that indicates the dilution of spike-in added to a specimen.

label: centrally registered identifier symbol
definition: A symbol that is part of a CRID and that is sufficient to look up a record from the CRID's registry.

label: lot number
definition: A lot number is an information content entity which is an identical sequence of character borne by part of manufactured product or its packaging for each instances of a product class in a discrete batch of an item. Lot numbers are usually assigned to each separate production run of an item. Manufacturing as a lot might be due to a variety of reasons, for example,  a single process during which many individuals are made from the same portion of source material. Lot numbers can be encoded in a pattern  of other information objects, such as bar codes, numerals, or patterns of dots.

label: model number
definition: A model number is an information content entity specifically borne by catalogs, design specifications, advertising materials, inventory systems and similar  that is about manufactured objects of the same class. The model number is an alternative term for the class. The manufactered objects may or may not also bear the model number. Model numbers can be encoded in a variety of other information objects, such as bar codes, numerals, or patterns of dots.

label: numeral
definition: A symbol that denotes a number.

label: serial number
definition: A serial number is an information content entity which is a unique sequence of characters borne by part of manufactured product or its packaging that is assigned to each individual in some class of products, and so can serve as a way to identify an individual product within the class. Serial numbers can be encoded in a variety of other information objects, such as bar codes, numerals, or patterns of dots.

label: version number
definition: A version number is an information content entity which is a sequence of characters borne by part of each of a class of manufactured products or its packaging and indicates its order within a set of other products having the same name.

label: integer numeral
definition: a numeral that denotes an integer

label: clinical history
definition: A series of statements representing health-relevant qualities of a patient and of a patient's family.

label: conclusion based on data
definition: An information content entity that is inferred from data.

label: exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history
definition: A information content entity that indicates the exposure of an individual to carcinogens in the workplace or environment.

label: hormonal birth control use history
definition: An information content entity that indicates whether a woman has ever used oral contraceptives in order to block ovulation and prevent the occurrence of pregnancy.

label: indicator of whether all inclusion criteria were met
definition: An information content entity  that indicates whether or not  an entity  has met all specific requirements in order to take part in a given process.

label: indicator of whether an inclusion criterion was met
definition: An information content entity that indicates whether or not  an entity has met a specific requirement in order to take part in a given process.

label: menopausal status
definition: An information content entity that indicates the state of a female's cessation of menstruation.

label: predicted value
definition: an information content entity that has been generated by a prediction process in which an estimate of a value of an entity is made which can be measured but without performing such a measurement. The value specification is intended to be close to the value a measurement process would produce modulo a prediction error.

label: reason for lack of data item
definition: An information content entity that provides an explanation why a data item is not provided.

label: record of missing knowledge
definition: a information content entity created to indicate that information about something is not available to the person recording it.

label: sequence feature annotation
definition: Information about a sequence region

label: testable hypothesis
definition: An information content entity that expresses an assertion that is intended to be tested.

label: value specification
definition: An information content entity that specifies a value within a classification scheme or on a quantitative scale.

label: analytical cytology data file
definition: A digital entity intended to capture data in analytical cytology domain.

label: centrally registered identifier
definition: An information content entity that consists of a CRID symbol and additional information about the CRID registry to which it belongs.

label: curated information
definition: A information content entity that has undergone a digital curation performed by a curator for accuracy checks and compliance with curation requirements. Information which has been assessed for accuracy by domain experts.

label: data item
definition: a data item is an information content entity that is intended to be a truthful statement about something (modulo, e.g., measurement precision or other systematic errors) and is constructed/acquired by a method which reliably tends to produce (approximately) truthful statements.

label: datum label
definition: A label is a symbol that is part of some other datum and is used to either partially define  the denotation of that datum or to provide a means for identifying the datum as a member of the set of data with the same label

label: directive information entity
definition: An information content entity whose concretizations indicate to their bearer how to realize them in a process.

label: document
definition: A collection of information content entities intended to be understood together as a whole

label: document part
definition: an information content entity that is part of a document

label: eMedical record
definition: An eMedical record is a digital document derived from a computer system used primarily for patient care in a clinical setting.  Not required to be compliant with requirements of 21 CFR Part 11.

label: eSource document
definition: an eSource document is a digital document consisting of a logical collection of Source data and other eSource documents that can be presented in an ordered way and capture the time of completion, change, and any signatures

label: electronic case report form
definition: An electronic case report form is a digital document used to record all of the protocol required information to be reported for each trial subject. An eCRF has the property that it can be audited and compliant with requirements of 21 CFR Part 11.

label: electronic case report tabulation
definition: An electronic case report tabulation is a digital document containing tabular data about multiple trial participants which is part of a clinical regulatory submission.  An eCRT has the property that it can be audited and compliant with requirements of 21 CFR Part 11  and has format suited to review by regulators.

label: figure
definition: An information content entity consisting of a two dimensional arrangement of information content entities such that the arrangement itself is about something.

label: fluorescence compensation matrix
definition: A fluorescence compensation matrix is a square matrix which is used as the left multiplier of the vector of fluorescence values while performing digital fluorescence compensation. Also, fluorescence compensation matrix is the inverse of the fluorescence spillover matrix.

label: list-mode data file
definition: A list-mode data file is a binary digital entity where events are stored sequentially, parameter by parameter.

label: narrative object
definition: A narrative object is an information content entity that is a set of propositions.

label: symbol
definition: An information content entity that is a mark(s) or character(s) used as a conventional representation of another entity.

label: textual entity
definition: A textual entity is a part of a manifestation (FRBR sense), a generically dependent continuant whose concretizations are patterns of glyphs intended to be interpreted as words, formulas, etc.

label: validated information
definition: an information content entity which results from a validation process aimed at confirming a claim, a finding or a predicted information entity about a material entity or a process by experimental means.

label: half maximal effective concentration (EC50)
definition: half maximal effective concentration (EC50) is a scalar measurement datum corresponding to the concentration of a compound which induces a response halfway between the baseline and maximum after some specified exposure time.

label: half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50)
definition: Half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) is a scalar measurement datum that measures the effectiveness of a compound to competitively inhibit a given process, and corresponds to the concentration of the compound at which it reaches half of its maximum inhibitory effect.

label: minimal inhibitory concentration
definition: A scalar measurement datum that indicates the lowest concentration at which a specific compound significantly inhibits a process from occurring compared to in the absence of the compound.

label: rate measurement datum
definition: A scalar measurement datum that represents the number of events occuring over a time interval

label: scalar score from composite inputs
definition: A measurement datum which is the result of combining multiple datum. For example, a mean or summary score.

label: N50
definition: the weighted median item size or N50 is a weighted median of the lengths of items, equal to the length of the longest item i such that the sum of the lengths of items greater than or equal in length to i is greater than or equal to half the length of all of the items. With regard to assemblies the items are typically contigs or scaffolds. It therefore denotes the ability of the software to create contigs and provides information about the resulting sequence assembly

label: length measurement datum
definition: A scalar measurement datum that is the result of measurement of length quality

label: mass measurement datum
definition: A scalar measurement datum that is the result of measurement of mass quality

label: random access memory size
definition: random access memory size is a scalar measurement datum which denotes the amount of physical memory know as random access memory present of a computer or required by a computational process or data transformation

label: sequencing library input quantity measurement datum
definition: A scalar measurement datum that indicates the amount of sequencing library used as input for a sequencer.

label: time measurement datum
definition: A scalar measurement datum that is the result of measuring a temporal interval

label: data representational model
definition: Data representational model is an information content entity of the  relationships between data items. A data representational model is encoded in a data format specification such as for cytoscape or biopax.

label: dose specification
definition: a directive information entity that describes the dose that will be administered to a target

label: action specification
definition: a directive information entity that describes an action the bearer will take

label: conditional specification
definition: a directive information entity that specifies what should happen if the trigger condition is fulfilled

label: data format specification
definition: A data format specification is the information content borne by the document published defining the specification. Example: The ISO document specifying what encompasses an XML document; The instructions in a XSD file

label: objective specification
definition: a directive information entity that describes an intended process endpoint. When part of a plan specification the concretization is realized in a planned process in which the bearer tries to effect the world so that the process endpoint is achieved.

label: plan specification
definition: A directive information entity with action specifications and objective specifications as parts that, when concretized, is realized in a process in which the bearer tries to achieve the objectives by taking the actions specified.

label: selection criterion
definition: A directive information entity which defines and states a principle of standard by which selection process may take place.

label: source code module
definition: A source code module is a directive information entity that specifies, using a programming language, some algorithm.

label: study design controlled variable
definition: Controlled variable specification  is a part of a study design. They are the entities that could vary, but are kept constant to prevent their influence on the effect of the independent variable on the dependent.

label: study design dependent variable
definition: dependent variable specification is part of a study design. The dependent variable is the event studied and expected to change when the independent variable varies.

label: study design independent variable
definition: a directive information entity that is part of a study design. Independent variables are entities whose values are selected to determine its relationship to an observed phenomenon (the dependent variable). In such an experiment, an attempt is made to find evidence that the values of the independent variable determine the values of the dependent variable (that which is being measured). The independent variable can be changed as required, and its values do not represent a problem requiring explanation in an analysis, but are taken simply as given. The dependent variable on the other hand, usually cannot be directly controlled

label: target gene specification
definition: is a directive information specifying a coding genomic region which is the focus of a planned process such as an assay, for instance in a environmental gene survey

label: target subfragment specification
definition: is a directive information specifying a genomic region, possibly located in a coding genomic region, which is the focus of a planned process such as an assay, for instance in a environmental gene survey

label: graph of vertices
definition: A construct that consists of many nodes connected with edges. The edges represent a relationship between the objects represented by the nodes.  A graph can be equivalently represented as a matrix.

label: Venn diagram
definition: A Venn diagram is a report graph showing all hypothetically possible logical relations between a finite collection of sets.

label: dendrogram
definition: A dendrogram is a report graph which is a tree diagram frequently used to illustrate the arrangement of the clusters produced by a clustering algorithm.

label: density plot
definition: A density plot is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data where the tint of a particular pixel corresponds to some kind of function corresponding the the amount of data points relativelly with their distance from the the pixel.

label: dot plot
definition: A dot plot is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data where each data point is represented by a single dot placed on coordinates corresponding to data point values in particular dimensions.

label: heatmap
definition: A heatmap is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data where the values taken by a variable(s) are shown as colors in a two-dimensional map.

label: histogram
definition: A histogram is a report graph which is a statistical description of a distribution in terms of occurrence frequencies of different event classes.

label: line graph
definition: A line graph is a type of graph created by connecting a series of data points together with a line.

label: scatter plot
definition: A scatterplot is a graph which uses Cartesian coordinates to display values for two variables for a set of data. The data is displayed as a collection of points, each having the value of one variable determining the position on the horizontal axis and the value of the other variable determining the position on the vertical axis.

label: compliance rule
definition: a compliance rule is a rule which ensures a compliance process occurs

label: stopping rule
definition: a stopping rule (criterion) is_a *rule* which causes a *stopping process* to happen

label: alignment counting algorithm
definition: An algorithm used to assign aligned sequence reads, resulting from a reference genome transcriptome alignment algorithm, to sequence features (e.g. genes or transcripts).

label: base calling algorithm
definition: An algorithm that assigns nucleotides to temporal or spatial peaks generated by a detector, such as peaks of light intensities generated by a DNA sequencer

label: reference genome-transcriptome alignment algorithm
definition: An algorithm that attempts to align a nucleic acid sequence to a reference genome and transcriptome.

label: sequence annotation algorithm
definition: An algorithm used to identify sequence features (e.g. protein coding regions) in the assembled contig sequence.  This may also include a description of any manual curation that may have generated or validated the annotation.

label: sequence assembly algorithm
definition: An algorithm used to assemble individual sequence reads into larger contiguous sequences (contigs).  Assembly details include but are not limited to assembler type (overlap-layout-consensus, deBruijn), assembler version, and any relevant quality control information such as per cent known genes/ESTs captured.

label: software interpreter
definition: A software interpreter is a software application that executes some specified input software.

label: direct submission to IEDB
definition: A report about experiments in an investigation that characterize immune epitopes, and was submitted directly by the authors to the Immune Epitope Database (IEDB)

label: investigation results report
definition: An investigation report is a report on the results of an investigation.

label: journal article
definition: a report that is published in a journal

label: BCL format
definition: A data format specification that is a binary file containing base calling data. These files are created by sequencing machines during the act of sequencing, and contain data about each of the nucleotide clusters on a sequencing flow cell.

label: differential expression analysis data
definition: The results of a differential expression analysis.

label: sequence library feature count data
definition: The results of a sequence data feature count tabulation.

label: background corrected data set
definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a background correction data transformation.

label: centrally registered identifier registry
definition: A CRID registry is a dataset of CRID records, each consisting of a CRID symbol and additional information which was recorded in the dataset through a assigning a centrally registered identifier process.

label: classified data set
definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a class prediction data transformation and consists of a data set with assigned class labels.
alternative_term: data set with assigned class labels

label: cluster
definition: A data set which is a subset of data that are a similar to each other in some way.

label: clustered data set
definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a class discovery data transformation and consists of a data set with assigned discovered class labels.
alternative_term: data set with assigned discovered class labels

label: data set of features
definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a descriptive statistical calculation data transformation and consists of producing a data set that represents one or more features of interest about the input data set.

label: data set of predicted values according to fitted curve
definition: A data set which is the output of a curve fitting data transformation in which the aim is to find a curve which matches a series of data points and possibly other constraints.

label: error corrected data set
definition: A data set that is produced as the output of an error correction data transformation and consists of producing a data set which has had erroneous contributions from the input to the data transformation removed (corrected for).

label: gene list
definition: A data set of the names or identifiers of genes that are the outcome of an analysis or have been put together for the purpose of an analysis.

label: normalized data set
definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a normalization data transformation.

label: reduced dimension data set
definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a data vector reduction data transformation and consists of producing a data set which has fewer vectors than the input data set.

label: time sampled measurement data set
definition: A data set that is an aggregate of data recording some measurement at a number of time points. The time series data set is an ordered list of pairs of time measurement data and the corresponding measurement data acquired at that time.

label: photograph
definition: A photograph is created by projecting an image onto a photosensitive surface such as a chemically treated plate or film, CCD receptor, etc.

label: denotator type
definition: A denotator type indicates how a term should be interpreted from an ontological perspective.

label: curation status specification
definition: The curation status of the term. The allowed values come from an enumerated list of predefined terms. See the specification of these instances for more detailed definitions of each enumerated value.

label: obsolescence reason specification
definition: The reason for which a term has been deprecated. The allowed values come from an enumerated list of predefined terms. See the specification of these instances for more detailed definitions of each enumerated value.

label: PCR program
definition: a PCR program is a plan specification which is executed during a polymerase chain reaction (PCR) by a thermocycler instrument that will iterate through the changes in temperature and duration of each of the annealing, denaturation, elongation steps for as many times as specified by the program.

label: algorithm
definition: A plan specification which describes the inputs and output of mathematical functions as well as workflow of execution for achieving an predefined objective. Algorithms are realized usually by means of implementation as computer programs for execution by automata.

label: grant
definition: A plan specification of organization A to give money to organization B so that B conducts investigations. Organization A has funder role and Organization B has research organization role.

label: investigation assay specification
definition: A plan specification which indicates the assay type used to obtain data.

label: programming language
definition: A language in which source code is written that is intended to be executed/run by a software interpreter. Programming languages are ways to write instructions that specify what to do, and sometimes, how to do it.

label: protocol
definition: A plan specification which has sufficient level of detail and quantitative information to communicate it between investigation agents, so that different investigation agents will reliably be able to independently reproduce the process.

label: software
definition: Software is a plan specification composed of a series of instructions that can be  interpreted by or directly executed by a processing unit.

label: software pipeline
definition: A plan specification that specifies a chain encoded in software of processing elements (processes, threads, coroutines, etc.), arranged so that the output of each element is the input of the next. Usually some amount of buffering is provided between consecutive elements.

label: specimen-based scope of investigation specification
definition: A plan specification which specifies the scope of an investigation based on the heterogeneity of organisms or type of material that are the specified input of specimen collection.

label: study design
definition: A plan specification comprised of protocols (which may specify how and what kinds of data will be gathered) that are executed as part of an investigation and is realized during a study design execution.

label: target capture specification
definition: A plan specification which specifies how the material enrichment procedure will influence the scale, or type of material that will be assayed in the specimen.

label: target material in specimen specification
definition: A plan specification which specifies the type of material that will be assayed in an investigation.

label: 3D structural organization datum
definition: A measurement datum that describes the structural orientation of a material entity in 3D space.

label: categorical measurement datum
definition: A measurement datum that is reported on a categorical scale

label: dose
definition: A measurement datum that measures the quantity of something that may be administered to an organism or that an organism may be exposed to. Quantities of nutrients, drugs, vaccines and toxins are referred to as doses.

label: number of live births
definition: A measurement datum of the total number of live births a female has had.

label: number of pregnancies
definition: A measurement datum of the total number of pregnancies a woman has had.

label: spike train datum
definition: A measurement datum which represents information about an ordered series of action potentials in an organism's CNS measured over time.

label: survival rate
definition: A measurement data that represents the percentage of people or animals in a study or treatment group who are alive for a given period of time after diagnosis or initiation of monitoring.

label: fluorescent reporter intensity
definition: A measurement datum that represents the output of a scanner measuring the intensity value for each fluorescent reporter.

label: latitude coordinate measurement datum
definition: A measurement datum that is the measure of the latitude coordinate of a site.

label: longitude coordinate measurement datum
definition: A measurement datum that is the measure of the longitude coordinate of a site.

label: measured expression level
definition: A measurement datum that is the outcome of the quantification of an assay for the activity of a gene, or the number of RNA transcripts.

label: number of lost events computer
definition: A measurement datum recording the number of measurement events lost due to overloading of the analysis chip in a flow cytometer instrument. The datum has a qualitative role

label: number of lost events electronic
definition: A measurement datum measuring the number of analysis events lost due to errors in data acquisition electronic coincidence in a flow cytometer instrument. The datum has a qualitative role.

label: number of particles in subset
definition: A measurement datum measuring the number of subjects in a defined subset in a flow cytometer instrument. The datum has a qualitative role

label: parameter threshold
definition: A measurement datum measuring the minimal signal that must be detected to generate an electrical event, as compared to the maximal detected signal in a flow cytometer instrument. The datum has a qualitative role

label: ratio of collected to emitted light
definition: A measurement datum measuring the amount of light collected s compared to the total amount of emitted light in the detector component of a flow cytometer instrument. The datum has a qualitative role

label: scalar measurement datum
definition: a scalar measurement datum is a measurement datum that is composed of two parts, numerals and a unit label.

label: sequence data
definition: A measurement datum that representing the primary structure of a macromolecule(it's sequence) sometimes associated with an indicator of confidence of that measurement.

label: sequence read length measurement datum
definition: A measurement datum that is the result of the measurement of the number of bases in a DNA or RNA sequence.

label: specimen harvest quantity
definition: A scalar measurement datum that indicates the amount of specimen collected.

label: photographic print
definition: A photographic print is a material entity upon which a photograph generically depends.

label: random access memory
definition: Random-access memory (RAM) is a form of computer data storage. A random-access device allows stored data to be accessed directly in any random order. In contrast, other data storage media such as hard disks, CDs, DVDs and magnetic tape, as well as early primary memory types such as drum memory, read and write data only in a predetermined order, consecutively, because of mechanical design limitations. Therefore, the time to access a given data location varies significantly depending on its physical location

label: abbreviation textual entity
definition: A textual entity listing abbreviations and their expansions that are used in a document.

label: author information textual entity
definition: A textual entity expression information about an author of a document. This information may include biographical information and may discuss how the authors' professional experiences are relevant to the work described in the document.

label: author summary textual entity
definition: A textual entity, distinct from the abstract, that describes the significance and broader context of the document content. The author summary is often written in a non-technical manner and is aimed at both scientists and non-scientist readers, e.g as described in the article submission guidelines for PLoS Genetics (http://journals.plos.org/plosgenetics/s/submission-guidelines).

label: availability textual entity
definition: A textual entity expressing the location of a resource, e.g. software, or the manner in which a resource can be obtained.

label: caption
definition: A textual entity that describes a figure

label: case report textual entity
definition: A textual entity that expresses a detailed account of a portion of the medical history for a specific patient.

label: citation
definition: a textual entity intended to identify a particular publication

label: comment on investigation
definition: A textual entity that is about any of the aspects of an investigation worth noting

label: conclusion textual entity
definition: A textual entity that expresses the results of reasoning about a problem, for instance as typically found towards the end of scientific papers.

label: conflict of interest textual entity
definition: A textual entity that expresses a situation involving one or more of the authors, or the funding source of a document whereby the authors or funding source stand to potentially gain (typically financially) from the results reported in the document.

label: consent textual entity
definition: A textual entity that documents the consenting process used to enroll patients in a study.

label: country name
definition: A textual entity that denotes a geographic location that is a site or part of a site that is identified as a country in the political geography.

label: diagnosis textual entity
definition: diagnosis is an assessment of a disease or injury, its likely prognosis and treatment.

label: document title
definition: A textual entity that names a document

label: ethical approval textual entity
definition: A textual entity that documents the ethical approval of some study design.

label: funding source declaration textual entity
definition: A textual entity documenting the source of funding that supported some study.

label: future directions textual entity
definition: A textual entity expressing ideas regarding future work relevant to work described in a document that could be done.

label: genome announcement textual entity
definition: A textual entity that describes the generation and public release of a novel, draft genome sequence.

label: hypothesis textual entity
definition: A textual entity that expresses an assertion that is intended to be tested.

label: institutional identification
definition: A textual entity intended to identify a particular institution

label: investigation description
definition: A textual entity that describes an investigation.

label: investigation title
definition: A textual entity that denotes an investigation.

label: keyword textual entity
definition: A textual entity listing keywords indicating the major theme(s) of a document.

label: patients textual entity
definition: A textual entity expressing information regarding the patients used in a study.

label: postal address
definition: A textual entity that is used as directive to deliver something to a person, or organization

label: pre-publication history textual entity
definition: A textual entity that expresses the pre-publication history (submission dates, reviewer comments, etc) for a document, often including a hyperlink to a web page detailing the information.

label: related work textual entity
definition: A textual entity that discusses work from other publications and expresses their relevancy to the content of a document.

label: requirements textual entity
definition: A textual entity that expresses the requirements necessary to use a resource, e.g. software.

label: sequence assembly name
definition: A textual entity that is used to denote a sequence assembly.

label: statistical analysis textual entity
definition: A textual entity documenting statistical analysis tools and techniques employed.

label: study limitations textual entity
definition: A textual entity addressing a shortcoming or bias of a study design or execution.

label: table
definition: A textual entity that contains a two-dimensional arrangement of texts repeated at regular intervals across a spatial range, such that the spatial relationships among the constituent texts expresses propositions

label: written name
definition: A textual entity that denotes a particular in reality.

label: running title
definition: A shorter version of a document title

label: table of abbreviations
definition: A table where the constituent texts are abbreviations and their expansions

label: table of contents
definition: A table that relates document parts to specific locations in a document (usually page numbers).  This is also a document part (subsumption there should be inferred).

label: table of figures
definition: A table that relates figures in a document to specific locations in that document (usually page numbers).  This is also a document part (subsumption there should be inferred).

label: diagram
definition: A figure that expresses one or more propositions

label: image
definition: An image is an affine projection to a two dimensional surface, of measurements of some quality of an entity or entities repeated at regular intervals across a spatial range, where the measurements are represented as color and luminosity on the projected on surface.

label: graph
definition: A diagram that presents one or more tuples of information by mapping those tuples in to a two dimensional space in a non arbitrary way.

label: questionnaire
definition: A document with a set of printed or written questions with a choice of answers, devised for the purposes of a survey or statistical study.

label: edited document
definition: A document which is the output of a document editing process

label: patent
definition: A document that has been accepted by a patent authority

label: publication
definition: A document that has been accepted by a publisher

label: report
definition: a document assembled by an author for the purpose of providing information for the audience. A report is the output of a documenting process and has the objective to be consumed by a specific audience. Topic of the report is on something that has completed. A report is not a single figure. Examples of reports are journal article, patent application, grant progress report, case report (not patient record)

label: publication about an investigation
definition: A publication that is about an investigation

label: abbreviations section
definition: A part of a document where abbreviations and their long-forms used within the document are listed.
alternative_term: abbreviations used|abbreviations|abbreviations list|list of abbreviations used|list of abbreviations

label: abstract
definition: A summary of the entire document that is substantially smaller than the document it summarizes.  It is about the document it summarizes.

label: acknowledgements section
definition: Part of a publication that is about the contributions of people or institutions other than the authors.

label: author contributions section
definition: A part of a publication that is about the specific contributions of each author

label: author information section
definition: A part of a document about the authors that provides biographical information and may discuss how the authors' professional experiences are relevant to the work described in the document.

label: author list
definition: part of a document that enumerates the authors of the document

label: author summary section
definition: A part of a document, distinct from the abstract, that describes the significance and broader context of the document content. The author summary is often written in a non-technical manner and is aimed at both scientists and non-scientist readers.

label: availability section
definition: A part of a document about a resource described in the document, e.g. software, that describes where and/or how that resource can be obtained.

label: case report section
definition: A part of a document about the medical history of a specific patient as it relates to the topic of the document.

label: conclusion section
definition: A part of a document used to summarize the findings discussed in the document. The conclusion section is typically found near the end of a document.

label: conflict of interest section
definition: A part of a document used to declare any competing interests regarding the authors and/or funding organization for the work described in the document.
alternative_term: declaration of competing interests|conflict of interest statement|disclosure of potential conflicts of interest|conflict of interest|competing interests

label: consent section
definition: A part of a document about the consent process that was used to enroll patients in a study.

label: copyright section
definition: A document part that describes  legal restrictions on making or distributing copies of the document

label: discussion section of a publication about an investigation
definition: A part of a publication about an investigation that is about the study interpretation of the investigation

label: ethical approval section
definition: A part of a document about the governance body responsible for approving the work discussed in a document on an ethical basis.

label: figures section
definition: A part of a document that contains one or more figures.

label: footnote
definition: A part of a document that is about a specific other part of the document.  Usually footnotes are spatially segregated from the rest of the document.

label: funding source declaration section
definition: A part of a document used to detail information regarding the source of funding used in support of the generation of the document content.
alternative_term: source of funding|sources of funding|funding information|funding statement|funding sources|funding|funding/support

label: future directions section
definition: A part of a document detailing extensions of the described work that may be implemented at some future point in time.
alternative_term: future challenges|future directions|future considerations|future perspectives|future research|future outlook|future developments|future research directions|future plans|future work|future prospects|future studies

label: genome announcement section
definition: A document part announcing the publication of a novel draft genome sequence.

label: institution list
definition: part of a document that has parts that are institution identifications associated with the authors of the document

label: introduction to a publication about an investigation
definition: A part of a publication about an investigation that is about the objective specification (why the investigation is being done)

label: keywords section
definition: A part of a document where keywords selected by the author to categorize the major theme(s) of a document are listed.

label: materials section
definition: A part of a document about the materials required to reproduce the content of the document.

label: methods section
definition: A part of a publication about an investigation that is about the study design of the investigation

label: notes section
definition: A part of a document containing typically short notes about the document itself and/or the authors. Often the notes section contains subsections related to funding, competing interests, ethical approval, etc.

label: patients section
definition: A part of a document about the patients that participated in a study.

label: pre-publication history section
definition: A part of the document about the publication history of a document. This section typically details dates of document submission to a journal and dates of any re-submissions as well as reviewer comments and responses to reviewers by the authors.

label: references section
definition: A part of a document that has citations as parts

label: related work section
definition: A part of a document about work in other publications that is relevant to the content of the document.

label: requirements section
definition: A part of a document about a resource described in the document, e.g. software, that describes the requirements necessary to use the resource, e.g. operating systems, hardware, etc. in the case of a software resource.

label: results section
definition: A part of a publication about an investigation that is about a study design execution

label: statistical analysis section
definition: A part of the document used to describe the statistical methodologies employed in the work presented in the document.

label: study limitations section
definition: A part of a document about biases or short comings related to the study design and execution.

label: supplementary material to a document
definition: part of a document that is segregated from the rest of the document due to its size

label: tables section
definition: A part of a document that contains one or more tables.

label: one dimensional cartesian spatial coordinate datum
definition: A cartesion spatial coordinate datum that  uses one value to specify a position along a one dimensional spatial region

label: three dimensional cartesian spatial coordinate datum
definition: A cartesion spatial coordinate datum that  uses three values to specify a position within a three dimensional spatial region

label: two dimensional cartesian spatial coordinate datum
definition: A cartesion spatial coordinate datum that  uses two values to specify a position within a two dimensional spatial region

label: tissue section thickness
definition: A length measurement datum that is the result of an assay measuring the thickness of a tissue section.

label: half life datum (t 1/2)
definition: The time it takes for 50% of a class of stochastic processes to occur.

label: age measurement datum
definition: A time measurement datum that is the result of measurement of age of an organism

label: computation run time
definition: computation run time is a time measurement datum which corresponds the time expressed in second, minute, hour necessary for a computer program to complete a process execution, for example genome assembly. It is an important metrics as it indicates the resource occupancy and computer program efficiency.

label: sampling time measurement datum
definition: A time measurement datum when an observation is made or a sample is taken from a material as measured from some reference point.

label: specimen collection time measurement datum
definition: A time measurement datum that is the measure of the time when the specimens are collected.

label: email address of Bioinformatics Resource Center contact person
definition: An email address of the person who is contact representative of a Bioinformatics Resource Center

label: email address of sequencing facility contact person
definition: An email address of the contact representative at the sequencing facility

label: email address of specimen collector
definition: An email address of the person collecting the specimen

label: email address of specimen provider principal investigator
definition: An email address of the principal investigator providing the specimens for the investigation

label: data encoding
definition: a documenting process to encode an information entity into a digital document

label: digital curation
definition: Digital curation is the process of establishing and developing long term repositories of digital assets for current and future reference by researchers, scientists, and historians, and scholars generally.

label: dose response curve
definition: A data item of paired values, one indicating the dose of a material, the other quantitating a measured effect at that dose. The dosing intervals are chosen so that effect values be interpolated by a plotting a curve.

label: survival curve
definition: A survival curve is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data where the percentage of survival is plotted as a function of time.

label: GenBank ID
definition: A CRID symbol uniquely indentifies the submitted GeneBank sequence record.

label: PubMed ID
definition: A CRID symbol that is sufficient to look up a citation from the PubMed, a literature database of life sciences and biomedical information.

label: SRS identifier
definition: An accession number that applies to a database record for an individual sample object in an NCBI Sequence Read Archive (SRA) submission. These records are imported from the NCBI BioSample database.

label: courier tracking number
definition: A centrally registered identifier symbol assigned by a courier organization in order to track the delivery of an item.

label: dbGaP study identifier
definition: A central registered identifier symbol that denotes a specific study in dbGaP.

label: digital object identifier
definition: A centrally registered identifier symbol used to uniquely identify objects given by International DOI Foundation. The DOI system is particularly used for electronic documents such as journal articles.

label: grant identifier
definition: A CRID symbol used to identify a grant.

label: individual organism identifier
definition: a CRID symbol used to distinguish one individual organism from another.

label: investigation identifier
definition: A CRID symbol used to identify an investigation.

label: specimen identifier
definition: A CRID symbol denotes a specimen and used to distinguish one specimen from another in an investigation.

label: author identification
definition: A textual entity intended to identify a particular author

label: alignment counting application
definition: A software application that implements an alignment counting algorithm, used to count the overlap of aligned sequencing reads with genes.

label: base calling application
definition: A base-calling application that implments a base-calling algorithm to convert BCL (binary base call) files, (e.g., those generated by Illumina sequencing systems) to standard FASTQ file formats for downstream analysis.

label: Rattus norvegicus
alternative_term: brown rat|rats|rat|Rattus sp. strain Wistar|Norway rat

label: Bioinformatics Resource Center contact person
definition: A person who is the contact representative of a Bioinformatics Resource Center

label: sequencing facility contact person
definition: A person who is the contact representative at the sequencing facility

label: specimen collector
definition: A person who collects the specimen

label: specimen provider principal investigator
definition: A person who is a principal investigator and provides the specimen

label: animal feeding
definition: animal feeding is a process in which animals are provided with food

label: calibration
definition: A planned process with the objective to establish the relationship between data produced by a measurement device and physical qualities. This is done by using the measurement device under defined conditions, and either tuning it to adjust the measured output, or record the output and use it as a reference in future measurements.

label: comparing prediction to measurement
definition: A planned process in which predicted values for some thing are compared to measured values for that thing.

label: data item extraction from journal article
definition: a planned process in which journal articles are read or processed and data items are extracted, typically for further analysis or indexing

label: determination if assay will provide reliable results
definition: A planned process that is used to assess whether an assay will provide reliable results based on the conditions or qualities of the inputs, devices, and other participants of the assay.

label: drawing a conclusion
definition: A planned process in which new information is inferred from existing information.

label: image creation
definition: A planned process that captures an image of an object.

label: informed consent process
definition: A planned process in which a person or their legal representative is informed about key facts about potential risks and benefits of a process and makes a documented decision as to whether the person in question will participate.

label: informing investigator of subject study arm
definition: A process in which an investigator is made aware of which study arm that a patient is participating in, for example whether they are receiving a placebo or a treatment with an investigational compound.

label: informing subject of study arm
definition: A process in which the subject is made aware of which study arm they are participating in, for example whether they are receiving a placebo or a treatment with an investigational compound.

label: laboratory animal care
definition: a process that realizes an animal care protocol that specifies how animals are kept and maintained

label: machine learning
definition: A planned process in which statistical techniques are used to give computers the ability to learn about patterns in data, without being explicitly programmed.  Learning is defined in this case as progressively improving performance on a specific task.

label: material maintenance
definition: a process with that achieves the objective to maintain some or all of the characteristics of an input material over time

label: performing a clinical assessment
definition: A protocol application during which a series of tests are made of a patient leading to determination of disease state, or condition.

label: presentation of stimulus
definition: a planned process in which an organism is exposed to some stimulus with the intent to invoke an action

label: service
definition: A planned process in which a service provider performs a task (i.e. a planned process) for a service consumer.

label: specimen collection process
definition: A planned process with the objective of collecting a specimen.

label: study design execution
definition: a planned process that carries out a study design

label: study intervention
definition: the part of the execution of an intervention design study which is varied between two or more subjects in the study

label: subject agrees they understand informed consent document
definition: A process in which a subject receives an informed consent document and agrees that they have understood it

label: supplying
definition: The planned process of providing material entities to be used in an investigation.

label: training process
definition: a process that achieves a training objective

label: treatment
definition: A processual entity whose completion is hypothesized (by a healthcare provider) to alleviate the signs and symptoms associated with a disorder

label: treatment portion of study execution
definition: A planned process, part of a study design execution, during which the treatment of subjects is ongoing

label: unblinding process
definition: The part of the study execution in which the subjects are told what study arm they are in and in which the investigators are told which subjects are in which trials

label: assay
definition: A planned process with the objective to produce information about the material entity that is the evaluant, by physically examining it or its proxies.

label: assigning a centrally registered identifier
definition: a planned process in which a new CRID is created, associated with an entity, and stored in the CRID registry thereby registering it as being associated with some entity

label: associating information with a centrally registered identifier in its registry
