definition: A planned process in which a CRID registry associates an information content entity with a CRID symbol
alternative_term: associating information with a CRID in the CRID registry

label: data transformation
definition: A planned process that produces output data from input data.

label: data visualization
definition: An planned process that creates images, diagrams or animations from the input data.

label: database extract, transform, and load process
definition: A planned process which takes as input a database and fills another database by extracting concretizations of information entities from the first, transforming them, and loading the transformed concretizations into the second.

label: document editing
definition: is a planned process with specified input original document and specified output edited document

label: documenting
definition: a planned process in which a document is created or added to by including the specified input in it.

label: drawing a conclusion based on data
definition: A planned process in which data gathered in an investigation is evaluated in the context of existing knowledge with the objective to generate more general conclusions or to conclude that the data does not allow one to draw general conclusion

label: exposure of material to environment
definition: a planned process in which an input material is exposed to a defined set of conditions in a controlled environment. The environment is a specified input.

label: freezing
definition: A planned process in which a material entity has it's temperature lowered to below the freezing point in order to bring it to a state in which it can be maintained at this lower temperature in order to preserve some of its qualities.

label: group assignment
definition: group assignment is a process which has an organism as specified input and during which a role is assigned

label: investigation
definition: a planned process that consists of parts: planning, study design execution, documentation and which produce conclusion(s).

label: looking up a centrally registered identifier
definition: A planned process in which a request to a CRID registry is made to return the information associated with a CRID symbol

label: material processing
definition: A planned process which results in physical changes in a specified input material

label: prediction
definition: a process by which an  event or an entity is described before it actually happens or is being discovered and identified.

label: selection
definition: A planned process which results in the creation of group of entity from a larger group by the application of predefined criteria.

label: sequence annotation
definition: A planned process that identifies and reports sequence features (e.g. protein coding regions) in sequence data.

label: validation
definition: a planned process with objective to check that the accuracy or the quality of a claim or prediction  satisfies some criteria and which is assessed by comparing with independent results

label: role of Institutional Review Board
definition: the role of a organization that is realized by members reviewing study designs for their agreement with regulations

label: role of regulator of chemical manufacturer
definition: a regulator involved with making and enforcing legislation and governmental orders relevant to chemical manufacture

label: role of regulator of consumables and medical devices
definition: a regulator involved with making and enforcing legislation and governmental orders relevant to the development, testing, manufacture and use of food, drugs and medical devices

label: biodiversity assessment objective
definition: biodiversity assessment objective is an objective of a planned process aimed at producing data item whose interpretation should provide insight about variety of biological species found in a biological sample at macroscopic or microscopic level

label: cellular feature identification objective
definition: Cellular_feature_identification_objective is a biological_feature_identification_objective role describing a study designed to examine or characterize a biological feature monitored at the cellular level, e.g. stage of cell cycle, stage of differentiation.

label: cellular structure feature identification objective
definition: is an objective specification which aims to discover cellular structure properties

label: molecular feature identification objective
definition: Molecular_feature_identification_objective is a biological_feature_identification_objective role describing a study designed to examine or characterize molecular features of a biological system, e.g. expression profiling, copy number of molecular components, epigenetic modifications.

label: molecular function identification objective
definition: is an objective specification which aims to discover molecular function realized by a molecular entity

label: organism feature identification objective
definition: Organism_feature_identification_objective is a biological_feature_identification_objective role describing a study designed to examine or characterize a biological feature monitored at the level of the organism, e.g. height, weight, stage of development, stage of life cycle.

label: organism identification objective
definition: A biological feature identification objective to identify the organism species in a specimen.

label: sequence feature identification objective
definition: Sequence_feature_identification_objective is a biological_feature_identification_objective role describing a study designed to examine or characterize molecular features exhibited at the level of a macromolecular sequence, e.g. nucleic acid, protein, polysaccharide.

label: role of certified IRB professional
definition: a role of which inheres in a Homo sapiens and realized during administration and oversight of the daily activities of Institutional Review Boards (IRBs) in the USA

label: role of impartial witness
definition: a role which inheres in a Homo sapiens and is realized during a clinical trial - the impartial witness is independent of the trial and cannot be unfairly influenced by people involved with the trial

label: role of legally acceptable representative
definition: a role which inheres in a human or organization who are able subject to applicable law to consent, on behalf of a prospective subject, to the subject`s participation in as clinical trial.

label: regulation-assigned role
definition: Regulation-assigned role is a regulatory role defined by legislation or governmental orders

label: regulator role
definition: a regulatory role involved with making and/or enforcing relevant legislation and governmental orders

label: calibration substance role
definition: A reference substance role that is realized when characteristics or responses elicited by the bearer are used to ensure an instrument is within protocol specification of accuracy or performance

label: dye swap quality control role
definition: a reference substance role that is borne by a material entity used in a dye swap design experiment for quality control or data normalization purposes

label: negative reference substance role
definition: a reference role in which the characteristics or responses elicited by the substance playing the reference substance role are used to establish a "no effect" response

label: nucleic acid template role
definition: a reference substance role which inheres in nucleic acid material entity and is realized in the process of using the nucleic acid bearing the template role as a reference during synthesis of a reverse copy.

label: positive reference substance role
definition: a reference role in which the characteristics or responses elicited by the substance playing the reference substance role are used to establish a "100%" response

label: reference genome role
definition: A reference substance role that is played by a reference genome when used during sequence alignment.

label: spike-in quality control role
definition: a reference substance role that is borne by a material entity with a known amount which is mixed into the evaluant of assays for quality control or data normalization purposes

label: affinity column
definition: An affinity column is a chromatography column that is used in affinity chromatography. Differences in the affinity of molecules to be separated to a stationary phase are used for discriminate retention.

label: capillary column
definition: A capillary column is a thin tube with a small inner diameter, usually around 0.5 mm.

label: carbon nanotube column
definition: Carbon nanotubes (CNTs) are known to have high thermal and mechanical stability and have the potential to be high-performance separation media that utilize the nanoscale interactions. CNT can be applied in long capillary tubes for the development of gas chromatography columns. A film of CNTs can be deposited by chemical vapor deposition (CVD) to form the stationary phase in the open tubular format. Altering the CVD conditions can vary the thickness and the morphology of the CNT film, which opens the possibility of selectivity tuning. The ability to fabricate long tubes coated with CNTs can be readily employed in other gas- and liquid-phase separations as well.

label: chromatofocusing column
definition: A chromatofocusing column is a chromatography column in which a resin is equilibrated at one pH and eluted at a second pH. The use of a weak ion-exchange resin causes a pH gradient to be formed at the solvent front owing to the buffering action of the resin. This pH gradient in turn leads to an ordering of proteins by isoelectric point. Molecules of charge sign opposite the resin bind; those of charge sign like the resin do not bind.

label: custom made column
definition: A custom made column ia a chromatography column which is specifically tailored according to the needs of the separation as requested by a scientist or working group.

label: gel permeation column
definition: A gel permeation column is a chromatography column which is used in gel permeation chromatography and which employs as the stationary phase a swollen gel made by polymerizing and cross-linking styrene in the presence of a diluent which is a nonsolvent for the styrene polymer. The polymer to be analyzed is introduced at the top of the column and then is elutriated with a solvent. The polymer molecules diffuse through the gel at rates depending on their molecular size.

label: glass column
definition: A glass column is a chromatography column made out of glass that is usually used for larger scale and preparative liquid chromatography separations.

label: high temperature column
definition: A high temperature column is a chromatography column which is suitable for and withstands very high temperatures in chromatography ovens.

label: ion exchange column
definition: An ion exchange column is a chromatography column that is used in ion exchange chromatography and anion or cation exchange resins to enable separation.

label: liquid chromatography column
definition: A liquid chromatography column is a chromatography column that is used in liquid chromatography, i.e. a column that is provided with a liquid sample mix.

label: normal phase column
definition: A normal phase column is a chromatography column in which the stationary phase is more polar than the mobile phase. Its counterpart is the reversed phase column.

label: open tubular column
definition: An open tubular column is a chromatography column in which the particles of the solid stationary phase or the support coated with a liquid stationary phase are concentrated on or along the inside tube wall leaving an open, unrestricted path for the mobile phase in the middle part of the tube.

label: organic acid column
definition: An organic acid column is a chromatography column which enables (reversed-phase) separation of hydrophilic aliphatic and aromatic organic acids with UV detection. Organic acid columns allow retention of polar and apolar organic acids and are hydrolysis resistant.

label: packed column
definition: A packed column is a chromatography column where the particles of the solid stationary phase or the support coated with a liquid stationary phase may fill the whole inside volume of the tube.

label: plunger column
definition: A plunger column is a chromatography column with adjustable heigth control. By means of an adjustable endpiece (plunger) the user can adjust the column length without disturbing the packed bed. Plunger columns can equalize volume changes and thus avoids dead volumes within the column.

label: protein column
definition: A protein column is a chromatography column used for the separation of complex protein mixtures. Protein columns enable sample desalting, followed by chromatographic separation or fractionation of complex protein samples, e.g. immunodepleted serum or plasma proteins.

label: reversed phase column
definition: A reversed phase column is a chromatography column in which the mobile phase is more polar than the stationary phase. Its counterpart is the normal phase column.

label: size exclusion column
definition: A size exclusion column is a chromatography column as used in size exclusion chromatography and which enables the separation of mixtures according to differrences in molecular size.

label: spin column
definition: A spin column is a chromatography column which is suitable for putting it into a centrifuge. A spin column enforces separation through increased G-forces while spinning the column in a centrifuge. It is often used in DNA gel extraction kits.

label: trap column
definition: A trap column is a chromatography column which is used prior to a, e.g. mass spectrometry, separation to clean up or concentrate controlled amounts of samples prior to elution to a detector.

label: Berichrom(r) Antithrombin III (A) Kit
definition: For the chromogenic determination of antithrombin III. Autoanalyzer method for undiluted samples. For the quantitative chromogenic determination of the functional activity of antithrombin III in plasma on autoanalyzers for the diagnosis of diminished AT III synthesis, increased consumption, and for monitoring substitution therapy. Berichrom(r) Antithrombin III (A) is used for the rapid determination of the physiologically active antithrombin III and permits the diagnosis of congenital and acquired antithrombin III deficiency, a condition frequently associated with an increased risk of thrombosis. Acquired antithrombin III deficiencies frequently occur due to consumption following major operations or due to disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) in cases of septicaemia, nephroses, liver parenchymal damage (hepatitis, drug intoxication, alcoholism) and estrogen-containing contraceptives. The test permits early detection of patients at increased risk for thrombosis. Kit contains: 6 x for 5.0 mL Thrombin (bovine), 3 x for 3.0 mL Substrate Reagent, 1 x 30.0 mL Buffer Solution

label: ERCC RNA spike-in
definition: A processed material developed by the External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) that  consists of 92 transcripts, derived and traceable from NIST-certified DNA plasmids.

label: NTP-2000
definition: a material consisting of 14.5% protein, 8.5% fat and 9.5% fiber produced to feed rodents

label: cell culture
definition: A material entity comprised of cultured cells and the media in which they are being propagated or stored.

label: cloning vector
definition: A cloning vector is an engineered material that is used as an input material for a recombinant vector cloning process to carry inserted nucleic acids. It contains an origin of replication for a specific destination host organism, encodes for a selectable gene product and contains a cloning site.

label: cultured cell population
definition: A processed material comprised of a collection of cultured cells that has been continuously maintained together in culture and shares a common propagation history.

label: delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy
definition: A processed material used for delivery of hormones in hormone replacement therapy.

label: device
definition: A material entity that is designed to perform a function in a scientific investigation, but is not a reagent.

label: enzyme-linked antibody
definition: A processed material that is comprised of an antibody that is covalently linked to an enzyme through bioconjugation. The enzyme can be used as a detection method when the enzyme's reaction produces a detectable signal, for example a color change when the substrate is added.

label: molecular-labeled material
definition: a material entity that is the specified output of an addition of molecular label process that aims to label some molecular target to allow for its detection in a detection of molecular label assay

label: paired-end library
definition: is a collection of short paired tags from the two ends of DNA fragments are extracted and covalently linked as ditag constructs

label: pill
definition: A dose of medicine or placebo in the form of a small pellet.

label: processed specimen
definition: A specimen that has been intentionally physically modified.

label: purified material
definition: A material entity that is generated by a purification process in which an input material is separated to obtain a fraction with a higher concentration of a desired component

label: recombinant vector
definition: A recombinant vector is created by a recombinant vector cloning process, and contains nucleic acids that can be amplified. It retains functions of the original cloning vector.

label: single fragment library
definition: is a collection of short tags from DNA fragments, are extracted and covalently linked as single tag constructs

label: Epstein Barr virus transformed B cell
definition: A material entity which results from viral transformation process using EBV as transformation agent when applied to B-cell entity

label: SIRV RNA spike-in
definition: A processed material that consists of transcript isoforms of 7 spike-in RNA variant (SIRV) genes and possibly the 92 External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) RNA spike-in genes.

label: agarose gel
definition: a material entity resulting from the polymerization of agarose after heating agarose suspended in some buffer solution

label: assay bead
definition: A globular or round particle of defined physicochemical properties and size which can be exploited as either the primary substance for detection or as a secondary solid platform for the attachment of bioactive molecules.

label: cell culture supernatant
definition: Supernatant of a cell culture is a material entity which contains media, supplements, and secreted products of the cells and becomes the environment of cultivated cell.

label: cell freezing medium
definition: A processed material that serves as a liquid vehicle for freezing cells for long term quiescent stroage, which contains chemicls needed to sustain cell viability across freeze-thaw cycles.

label: cell lysate
definition: a cell lysate is a material entity which is output of a cell lysis process

label: cell pellet
definition: A material entity which results from the aggregation of cells produced by the application of centrifugal force to a liquid containing cells in suspension

label: culture medium
definition: a processed material that provides the needed nourishment for microorganisms or cells grown in vitro.

label: decapitated organism
definition: decapitated organism is an organism which has had it's head removed

label: eluate
definition: a eluate is a material entity which results from an elution, e.g. from a chromatography column. it has as part a material entity with role mobile phase

label: extract
definition: an extract is a material entity which results from an extraction process

label: genetically modified material
definition: a material entity, organism or cell,  that is the output of a genetic transformation process.

label: multiplexed sequencing library
definition: a multiplexed library is a material entity which is the output of a library preparation process that uses a ligation step to attach a unique multiplexing sequence identifier to a specific sample, then mixes several such tagged samples prior to the library amplification process proper. A multiplexed library allows the sequencing of several samples in one sequencing run.

label: organ section
definition: A processed material which derives from an organ and results from a process of dissection or histological sample preparation a portion(formerly an organ section is portion of an organ removed from the context of the organ)

label: particle delivery vessel
definition: Part of the fluidics subsystem. A particle delivery vessel is used to introduce either a single sample or multiple samples to a flow cytometer. The most common particle delivery vessel is a sample tube.

label: peptide construct
definition: a material entity synthesized to contain a number of peptides conjugated together in a non-linear fashion

label: physical document
definition: A physical document is an object serving as a record of information by means of symbolic marks.

label: polyacrylamide gel
definition: a material entity resulting from the polymerization of acrylamide with TEMED in some buffer solution

label: precipitate
definition: a precipitate is a material entity which is output of a precipitation process

label: reagent
definition: A biological or chemical entity that bears a reagent role in virtue of it being intended for application in a scientific technique  to participate in (or have molecular parts that participate in) a chemical reaction that facilitates the generation of data about some distinct entity, or the generation of some distinct material specified output.

label: screening library
definition: a screening library is a collection of materials engineered to identify qualities of a subset of its members during a screening process?

label: xenograft
definition: A material entity which results from the transplantation of living cells, tissues or organs  from on organism of one species to an organism of another species.

label: liquid chromatography instrument
definition: A chromatography device that dissolves a mixture in liquid mobile phase to separate the analyte to be measured from other molecules in the mixture and allows it to be isolated

label: chart recorder
definition: The chart recorder is a device that transduces signal-intensities into a graphical peak output: As the separated components of the gas sample emerge into the detector, the change in voltage in the detecting bridge circuit causes a representative peak to be drawn on a chart recorder. The position of the peak along the time axis of the chart measures the component's retention time, which identifies the component. This is directly related to carrier gas flow rate, temperature and column packing and dimensions. The area under each peak is proportional to the concentration of the component of the sample. The area of the peaks inscribed on the chart recorder can be determined by multiplying the height of the peak in mm, by the width of the peak in mm at 1/2 the peak height. The calibration curves for use with the chart recorder are therefore peak area plotted against concentration.

label: chromatography consumable
definition: A chromatography consumable is a consumable that is used in a chromatography experiment.

label: chromatography splitter
definition: An adjustable restriction that is placed in the waste outlet to allow the necessary pressure to develop at the column inlet to force a flow (q ml/min) through the column. If the flow of mobile phase is Q ml/min then the waste flow will be (Q-q) ml/min. by adjusting the waste flow, the proportion of the sample entering the capillary column can be varied over a wide range of values and the necessary minimum permissible volume for the particular column in use can be selected for analysis. Unfortunately, the fraction taken in this way may not be representative of the original sample. This is due to the individual solutes in the mixture having different diffusivities and, thus, they distribute themselves across the sampling tube in an irregular manner. In general, the components with higher diffusivities (e.g., those solutes of lower molecular weight) will diffuse away from the bulk sample more quickly than those having lower diffusivities.

label: column adapter
definition: An Adapter that enabled the connection of a column to additional devices.

label: column cartridge
definition: A device that binds the chromatography column and additional connector elements and / or valves or syringes into one physical unity for further processing.

label: column compartment
definition: For chromatography analyses, the ability to maintain a stable column environment regardless of ambient temperature fluctuations is critical for maintaining retention time precision. In order to ensure such stable conditions at different chromatography steps a column compartment can be installed that ensures e.g. stable temperature of the column in a given step.

label: column connector
definition: A device that connects two or more columns together in a functional way with leak-tight connection, low dead volume, low thermal mass and high inertness.

label: column frit
definition: A part of the column content that separates column packing compartments. In radial columns the packing is supported between two cylindrical frits and the gap between represents the bed height or column length. The outer frit is the column inlet and consequently the sample initially has a large area of stationary phase with which to interact. Frits are porous metal products to prevent unwanted particles from entering the chromatography system. These particles may come from the sample, the solvent or debris generated by the chromatography system itself. Such particles entering the system may lead to clogging of capillaries, interference with the chromatography by changing chromatographic parameters or disturbance of the detector function. Characteristics of a frit, besides the diameter and the thickness, is the porosity (pore distribution, density).

label: column jacket
definition: A column jacket is a piece of column chromatography equipment that covers a column in order to ensure thermoisolation and create a controllable thermostatic microenvironment.

label: gas chromatography equipment
definition: Any device used in a gas chromatography experiment.

label: guard column
definition: Guard columns are installed between the injection valve and the analytical or preparative column and here will remove contaminants and prolong the lifetime of the columns.

label: liquid chromatography valve
definition: A sample valve that must be able to sustain pressures up to 10,000 p.s.i., although it is most likely to operate on a continuous basis, at pressures of 3,000 p.s.i. or less. The higher the operating pressure the tighter the valve seating surfaces must be forced together to eliminate any leak. It follows that any abrasive material, however fine, that passes into the valve can cause the valve seating to become scored each time it is rotated which will ultimately lead to leaks. This will cause the sample size to vary between samples and eventually affect the accuracy of the analysis. It follows that any solid material must be carefully removed from any sample before filling the valve. The sample volume of an internal loop valve is situated in the connecting slot of the valve rotor and can be used only for relatively small sample volumes. Internal sample loop valves provide samples with volumes ranging from 0.1 ml to about 0.5 ml. Valve operation is shown in figure 6. The left-hand side diagram shows the load position. The sample occupies the rotor slot and has been filled by passing the sample from an appropriate syringe through the rotor slot to waste. While loading the sample, the mobile phase supply is passed through the valve directly to the column. To place the sample onto the column, the valve is then rotated and the valve slot containing the sample is now placed between the solvent supply and the column. As a result, the sample is passed into the column by the flow of solvent.

label: needle assembly
definition: The needle assembly attached to the autosampler, comprises the injector needle that feeds a sample or carrier gas into the inlet

label: sample injection system
definition: An automated chromatography system that injects the sample into the chromatography columns in order to increase speed and minimize human involvement in the purification process for  better reproducibility.

label: sample inlet
definition: The column inlet (or injector) provides the means to introduce a sample into a continuous flow of carrier gas. The inlet is a piece of hardware attached to the column head.

label: transfer line
definition: A combination of devices that are used in connection with a sampling head for transferring components of an applied sample to the analyzing part of a chromatography system.

label: tandem mass spectrometer
definition: A mass spectrometer in which ions are subjected to two or more sequential stages of analysis (which may be separated spatially or temporally) according to the quotient mass/charge.

label: role of independent data monitoring committee
definition: a trial monitor role charged recommending whether to continue, modify, or end the trial

label: competitive binding reference ligand role
definition: A positive reference substance role that inheres in a material entity that is known to bind to a target entity, and that is realized in a competitive binding assay that has as specified input the target entity, an evaluant and the positive reference substance, where the binding of the evaluant to the target is measured based on the evaluant's ability to compete with the positive reference substance for binding to the target.

label: hypothesis driven investigation
definition: is an investigation with the goal to test one or more hypothesis

label: hypothesis generating investigation
definition: is an investigation in which data is generated and analyzed with the purpose of generating new hypothesis

label: sequence annotation reporting role
definition: A reporting party role that is realized by a person or organization who reports the feature annotation results from the analysis of a macromolecular sequence.

label: 3D structure determination assay
definition: An assay that determines the 3-dimensional configuration of an input material.

label: Bernoulli trial
definition: An assay where the output data is a datum with one of two values denoting success and failure.

label: ChIP assay
definition: An assay in which portions of chromatin, the ordered and organized complex of DNA and its interaction partners that make up a chormosome, is extracted and purified by immunoprecipitation with antibodies or tags, and subsequently analyzed

label: DNA replication timing by array assay
definition: An assay which quantifies the timing of DNA replication as a function of genome position using array technology.

label: DNA sequence feature detection assay
definition: An assay with the objective to determine a sequence feature of DNA

label: DNA sequence variation detection assay
definition: An assay that measures changes (expansion, amplification, deletion, mutation) in the sequence of a DNA molecule.

label: NMR spectroscopy assay
definition: An assay that exploits the magnetic properties of certain nuclei (those with a spin) to resonate when placed in particular magnetic field conditions. Instruments recording NMR spectrum and sets of analysis can be used to deduce identity of chemical as well as composition of complex chemical mixtures.

label: RNA interactome capture
definition: An assay that identifies RNA binding proteins by cross-linking RNA and proteins with UV light, then purifying the bound complexes by oligo(dT) capture. Finally, the complexes are analyzed by mass spectrometry.

label: RNA protection assay
definition: An assay that determines the presence and estimates abundance of transcript species by first creating an homo or heteroduplex by adding a specific, complementary sequence to the sequence of interest and then exposing the mixture of ribonuclease, which will degrade only single stranded molecules. A detection step will reveal if the sample contained a sequence of interest.

label: activated partial thromboplastin time assay
definition: An assay that evaluates blood coagulation by measuring the time required for the appearance of fibrin strands following the mixing blood or plasma with phospholipid platelet substitute (e.g., crude cephalins, soybean phosphatides). It is a test of the intrinsic pathway (factors VIII, IX, XI, and XII) and the common pathway (fibrinogen, prothrombin, factors V and X) of blood coaguation . It is used as a screening test and to monitor heparin therapy.

label: age determination assay
definition: An assay that determines the duration of part of the life of an organism, where the initial time point is the beginning of some transitional state (such as birth or when planted).

label: analyte assay
definition: An assay with the objective to capture information about the presence, concentration, or amount of an analyte in an evaluant.

label: array based nucleic acid structure mapping assay
definition: An assay which aims to provide information about the in vivo organization/structure of nucleic acids using chemical or enzymatic probes using a microarray.

label: assay detecting IFN-gamma production
definition: An assay that determines information about the production of the cytokine interferon gamma

label: assay detecting a molecular label
definition: An assay that detects the presence or a quality of a molecular label which is a proxy for the detection of the molecular target to which the label is attached

label: assay for transposase-accessible chromatin using sequencing
definition: An assay to capture the location of open chromatin, DNA-binding proteins, individual nucleosomes and chromatin compaction at nucleotide resolution by Tn5 transposase insertion.

label: binding assay
definition: An assay with the objective to characterize the disposition of two or more material entities to form a complex.

label: copy number variation profiling assay
definition: An assay that determines lost or amplified genomic regions of DNA by comparing genomic DNA originating from tissues from the same or different individuals using specific techniques such as CGH, array CGH, SNP genotyping

label: cytochalasin-induced inhibition of actin polymerization assay
definition: An assay which uses compound cytochalasin (CHEBI: 23528) to block actin polymerization-dependent cell motility (GO:0070358) and actin filament polymerization (GO:0030041).

label: cytometry assay
definition: An assay that measures properties of cells.

label: efficacy of epitope intervention experiment
definition: An assay that tests  if inducing an epitope specific immune response in an organism has an effect, such as the ability to prevent, treat or excarbate diseases in the organism.

label: electrophysiology assay
definition: An assay that measures the electrical properties of biological cells or tissues. Typically, this assay will generate measurements of voltage changes or electric current (or other associated variables such as impedence or capacitance).

label: epigenetic modification assay
definition: An assay that identifies epigenetic modifications including histone modifications, open chromatin, and DNA methylation.

label: extracellular electrophysiology recording assay
definition: An electrophysiology recording assay where the recording location of the electrode is extracellular

label: extrachromosomal circular DNA sequencing assay
definition: An assay which aims at identifying the endogenous population of extrachromosomal circular DNA originating from a subset of genomic loci and potentially having profound consequences on the regulatory and coding capabilities of these regions. The assay includes creation of a library out of the circular DNA molecules and subsequent sequencing using parallelized sequencing methods.

label: fluorescence detection assay
definition: An assay in which a material's fluorescence is determined.

label: footprinting assay
definition: An assay that measures ligand binding and conformational changes by the solvent accessibility of the backbone, bases, or side-chain structures of macromolecules through their sensitivity to chemical or enzymatic cleavage or modification reactions.

label: gene dosage assay
definition: An assay that measures changes in phenotype due to increased or decreased dosage of a single allele of a gene.

label: gene knock-down assay
definition: An assay which transiently disrupts gene transcripts by expressing antisense RNA constructs or delivering RNA interfering molecules in cells.

label: glucose tolerance test
definition: An assay that measures glucose clearance from blood over time by repeated glucose measurement in blood serum or plasma after the administration of a glucose bolus in-vivo. This assay can be used to evaluate the severity of insulin resistance or the efficiency of glucose clearance.

label: handedness assay
definition: An assay that measures the unequal distribution of fine motor skill between the left and right hands typically in human subjects by means of some questionnaire and scoring procedure.

label: hematology assay
definition: An assay that studies blood and blood producing organs using a variety of techniques and instruments

label: histological assay
definition: An assay that uses visual examination of cells or tissue (or images of them) to make an assessment regarding a quality of the cells or tissue. This assay can include steps of staining, imaging, and judgement.

label: imaging assay
definition: An assay that produces a picture of an entity.

label: immune epitope assay
definition: An assay that detects the binding of an epitope to an adaptive immune receptor or a immune response process resulting from such a binding event

label: immune response assay
definition: An assay that determines information about an immune response

label: in container assay
definition: An assay in which a measurement is made by observing entities located in a container.

label: in live cell assay
definition: An assay in which a measurement is made by observing entities located in a live cell.

label: in live organism assay
definition: An assay in which a measurement is made by observing entities located in an organism.

label: in vivo intervention experiment
definition: An assay in which the effect of a targeted process (the intervention) on an organism is tested.

label: in-situ hybridization assay
definition: An assay that localizes a specific DNA or RNA sequence within a portion or section of tissue using artificially induced nucleic hybridization.

label: infectious agent detection assay
definition: An assay that measures the presence or amount of an infectious agent in an evaluant

label: intra cellular electrophysiology recording assay
definition: An electrophysiology recording assay where the recording location of the electrode is intracellular

label: longitudinal mass measurement assay
definition: An assay that measures the mass of a material at two or more time points

label: mass measurement assay
definition: An assay that determines the mass of an evaluant

label: mass spectrometry assay
definition: An assay that identifies the amount and type of material entities present in a sample by fragmenting the sample and measuring the mass-to-charge ratio of the resulting particles.

label: metabolite profiling assay
definition: An assay that detects and identifies chemical entities resulting from biochemical and cellular metabolism

label: methylation-specific polymerase chain reaction assay
definition: An assay that uses initial modification of DNA by sodium bisulfite, converting all unmethylated, but not methylated, cytosines to uracil, and subsequent amplification with primers specific for methylated versus unmethylated DNA.

label: nuclear ligation assay
definition: An assay that detects the proximity of chromosomal DNA through the use of a ligation reaction in isolated nuclei.

label: organism identification assay
definition: An assay that identifies the organism species in a specimen.

label: physical examination of individual
definition: An assay that produces a description of the qualities of an entity that has not been transformed, through observation and physical, non-invasive techniques.

label: promoter activity detection by reporter gene assay
definition: An assay in which the activity of a promoter in a cell is monitored by using a reporter gene that was inserted in a genomic location under control of the promoter and whose expression can be easily detected based on qualities or functions of the gene.

label: protein expression profiling assay
definition: An assay that determines protein expression and translation activity using protein extracts collected from a material entity.

label: protein localization assay
definition: An assay that determines the specific location of a protein. Subcellular localization is distinguished from tissue-based localization based on the type of microscopy applied.

label: protein-protein interaction detection assay
definition: An assay that determines interactions between proteins, such as protein-protein binding.

label: prothrombin time assay
definition: An assay that measures the prothrombin ratio, which is the prothrombin time for a patient, divided by the result for control plasma. Most commonly the test is preformed using blood plasma. Blood is drawn into a test tube containing liquid citrate, which acts as an anticoagulant. An excess of calcium is added to enable the blood to clot again.Tissue factor (also known as factor III or thromboplastin) is added, and the time the sample takes to clot is measured optically as the prothrombin time, which is compared to a control sample.

label: pulse stable isotope labeling by amino acids in cell culture
definition: An assay that detects differences in protein abundance using samples that have been metabolically labeled in vivo with a stable non-radioactive heavy isotope containing amino acid for a short period of time. After diluting the pulsed cells into growth media without label, high resolution mass spectrometry-based proteomics is used to analyze the time-dependent decay and determine protein stability.

label: radio immuno assay
definition: An assay in which a radioactive labeled antigen or antibody is used to determine the interaction between an antigen and its receptor. This can be used to detect the presence of an antigen of interest in an input sample or determine the specificity of an input antibody.

label: radioactivity detection
definition: An assay that measures the amount of radiation in the radioactive spectrum (alpha, beta or gamma rays) emitted from an input material.

label: real time polymerase chain reaction assay
definition: An assay, based on the PCR, that amplifies and simultaneously quantifies a specific DNA molecule based on the use of complementary probes/primers. It enables both detection and quantification (as absolute number of copies or relative amount when normalized to DNA input or additional normalizing genes) of one or more specific sequences in a DNA sample.
alternative_term: kinetic polymerase chain reaction|qPCR|quantitative real time polymerase chain reaction|Q-PCR

label: real time reverse-transcription polymerase chain reaction assay
definition: An assay that uses a reverse transcription step (an RNA strand is reverse transcribed into its DNA complement using the enzyme reverse transcriptase) before a PCR assay.

label: reporter gene assay
definition: An assay that detects expression of a reporter gene that was inserted under the control of a regulatory sequence of interest.

label: reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction assay
definition: An assay that determines the concentration of RNA in a sample in which an RNA strand is first reverse transcribed into its DNA complement (complementary DNA, or cDNA) using the enzyme reverse transcriptase, and the resulting cDNA is amplified using traditional or real-time PCR.

label: sequencing assay
definition: An assay the uses chemical or biochemical means to infer the sequence of a biomaterial

label: single-nucleotide-resolution nucleic acid structure mapping assay
definition: An assay that provides information about the secondary structure of nucleic acids using chemical or enzymatic probing to establish the extent of base-pairing or solvent accessiblity.

label: spectrolyse heparin antifactor-Xa assay
definition: An assay that quantitatively measures heparin in human plasma using Factor Xa and Antithrombin III in excess, where the rate of Factor Xa inhibition is directly proportional to the heparin concentration. The residual Factor Xa activity, measured with a Factor Xa-specific chromogenic substrate, is inversely proportional to the heparin concentration.

label: substance detection assay
definition: An assay that detects a specified substance

label: survival assessment assay
definition: An assay that measures the occurrence of death events in one or more organisms over time

label: temperature measurement assay
definition: An assay to determine the temperature of an evaluant.

label: thrombin time assay
definition: An assay that measures the time between the addition of the thrombin and the clot formation in plasma.

label: transcription profiling assay
definition: An assay that determines gene expression and transcription activity using ribonucleic acids collected from a material entity.

label: tumor grading
definition: An assay that determines the grade (severity/stage) of a tumor sample, used in cancer biology to describe abnormalities/qualities of tumor cells or tissues. Values can be described by terms from NCI Thesaurus.

label: viral hemagglutination inhibition assay
definition: An assay that measures the ability of an evaluant to inhibit hemagglutination by a virus. Hemagglutinin is a viral protein which binds to sialic acid receptors on cells or to erythrocytes, causing the cells to clump. Loss of clumping indicates hemagglutination inhibition by the evaluant.
alternative_term: viral haemagglutinin inhibition assay|biological activity|HIA|hemagglutination inhibition|HAI

label: volume measurement assay
definition: An assay to determine the volume of an evaluant.

label: FWER adjusted p-value
definition: A quantitative confidence value resulting from a multiple testing error correction method which adjusts the p-value used as input to control for Type I error in the context of multiple pairwise tests

label: q-value
definition: A quantitative confidence value that measures the minimum false discovery rate that is incurred when calling that test significant.  To compute q-values, it is necessary to know the p-value produced by a test and possibly set a false discovery rate level.

label: p-value
definition: A quantitative confidence value that represents the probability of obtaining a result at least as extreme as that actually obtained, assuming that the actual value was the result of chance alone.

label: standard error
definition: A quantitative confidence value which is the standard deviations of the sample in a frequency distribution, obtained by dividing the standard deviation by the total number of cases in the frequency distribution.

label: sample preparation for sequencing assay
definition: A sample preparation for assay that preparation of nucleic acids for a sequencing assay

label: Dulbecco's modified Eagle medium
definition: A culture medium containing iron, phenol red, amino acids, salts, glucose and vitamins.

label: chemical cleavage
definition: chemical cleavage is a protocol application relying on a chemical compound to cause the fragmentation of an input material that is susceptible to that chemical agent

label: cross linking
definition: A process in which bonds are created that link one polymer to another

label: denaturing
definition: Is a process in which the tertiary or secondary structure of a polymer is disrupted

label: establishing cell culture
definition: a process through which a new type of cell culture or cell line is created, either through the isolation and culture of one or more cells from a fresh source, or the deliberate experimental modification of an existing cell culture (e.g passaging a primary culture to become a secondary culture or line, or the immortalization or stable genetic modification of an existing culture or line).

label: induced hemagglutination
definition: The clumping or clustering of red blood cells caused by certain viruses, antibodies, or other substances

label: library preparation
definition: is a process which results in the creation of a library from fragments of DNA using cloning vectors or oligonucleotides with the role of adaptors.

label: material combination
definition: is a material processing with the objective to combine two or more material entities as input into a single material entity as output.

label: phage display library panning
definition: Phage display library panning is a process in which a diverse collection of phages encoding peptides or proteins are screened and the ones encoding active peptides/proteins are selected in an iterative process similar to natural selection.

label: vaccine preparation
definition: vaccine preparation is a planned  process with specified output a vaccine

label: Immunization in vitro
definition: Process of administering an object playing the role of immunogen to a cell culture

label: addition of molecular label
definition: a material processing technique intended to add a molecular label to some input material entity, to allow detection of the molecular target of this label in a detection of molecular label assay

label: artificially induced DNA repair
definition: a protocol application to repair damaged DNA molecules

label: artificially induced cell membrane lysis
definition: a material transformation to break the membranes of cells, releasing the cells contents; input=>cells; output=>cell_lysate

label: artificially induced methylation
definition: A planned process of adding methyl groups to polymers

label: artificially induced nucleic acid hybridization
definition: Is a material transformation in which strands of nucleic acids that are (somewhat) complementary form a double-stranded molecule. Has input at least two single stranded molecules of nucleic acid molecules.

label: artificially induced reverse transcription
definition: a protocol with the objective to transcribe single-stranded RNA into complementary DNA (cDNA)

label: cell co-culturing
definition: A material combination in which cell cultures of two or more different types are are combined and allowed to culture as one.

label: cell culture expansion
definition: a processual entity that results in the increase of cell numbers

label: cell cycle synchronization
definition: a process with the objective to obtain a cell culture in which all cells are in the same stage of the cell cycle

label: cell fixation
definition: a protocol application to preserve defined  qualities of cells or tissues (sample) which may otherwise change over time

label: cell permeabilization
definition: A protocol application to permeabilize cell membranes, allowing molecules to more easily pass through the membrane than was possible prior to the protocol application

label: dissection
definition: A planned process that separates and isolates tissues for surgical purposes, or for the analysis or study of their structures.

label: elution
definition: the process of extracting one material from another by washing with a solvent to remove adsorbed material from an adsorbent (as in washing of loaded ion-exchange resins to remove captured ions)

label: enzymatic amplification
definition: the use of enzymes to increase the number of molecules of a biomaterial

label: enzymatic cleavage
definition: enzymatic cleavage is a protocol application to digest the fraction of input material that is susceptible to that enzyme

label: enzymatic ligation
definition: An enzymatic ligation is a planned process in which molecules  are joined by covalent bonds through the action of an material entity with a ligase activity

label: experimental disease induction
definition: a protocol application to induce a specific disease in an organism

label: genetic transformation
definition: the introduction. alteration or integration of genetic material into a cell or organism

label: histological sample preparation
definition: histological sample preparation is the preparation of an input tissue via slicing and labeling to make tissue microstructure of interest visible in a future histology assay

label: immobilization
definition: immbolization is a process by which material entity become (possibly covalently but not necessarily) attached to the surface of another material entity used a substratum.

label: ionize process
definition: a physical process of converting an atom or molecule into an ion by adding or removing charged particles such as electrons or other ions. This excludes chemical processes of dissociation.

label: irradiation
definition: irradiation is a process by which a material entity is exposed to radiative energy, which could be ionizing radiation (such as gamma rays or X-rays)  or not such as UV light or microwaves

label: killing
definition: A protocol application in which an organism is intentionally put to death

label: manufacturing
definition: Manufacturing is a process with the intent to produce a processed material which will have a function for future use. A person or organization (having manufacturer role) is a participant in this process

label: material component separation
definition: a material processing in which components of an input material become segregated in space

label: nucleic acid hybridization
definition: a planned process by which totally or partially complementary, single-stranded nucleic acids are  combined into a single molecule called heteroduplex or homoduplex to an extent depending on the amount of complementarity.

label: polymerization
definition: polymerization is process by which molecular entity of small mass are aggregated in motifs over the course of a chemical reaction catalyzed by enzymes or other molecular entities acting as catalyst. polymerization results in molecular entity of high molecular weight

label: recombinant vector cloning
definition: a planned process with the objective to insert genetic material into a cloning vector for future replication of the inserted material

label: sample preparation for assay
definition: A sample_preparation_for_assay is a protocol_application including material_enrollments and biomaterial_transformations. definition_source: OBI.

label: selection by survival
definition: the use of environmental conditions to select for the organism or cells that have a certain trait

label: sequencing library multiplexing
definition: a planned process which consists in running a set of samples as a pool in one single instrument run of data acquisition process while retaining the ability to associate individual results to each of the individual input samples thanks to the use of a multiplex identifier, introduced during the ligation step of the individual library preparation and specific to a given sample.

label: specimen family creation
definition: A material processing that has as its input a specimen and as its output a collection of specimens.

label: staining
definition: Staining is a process which results in the addition a class-specific (DNA, proteins, lipids, carbohydrates) dye to a substrate to qualify or quantify the presence of a specific compound.

label: synthesis
definition: the construction of a biomaterial from simpler biomaterials

label: transplantation
definition: a protocol application to replace an organ or tissue of an organism

label: washing
definition: washing is a process by which a material entity acting as  contaminant (e.g. excess staining reagent) is removed by application of one or more cycles of solution in flow.

label: protocol optimization objective
definition: Protocol_optimization is a protocol_testing_objective role describing a study designed to identify the best protocol.  This may be carried out by comparing different protocols or by modifying the parameters used within a single protocol.

label: to be treated with active ingredient role
definition: A study subject role which begins to exist when a subject is assigned to be one of those who will receive active ingredient, and is realized in a study execution in which they receive the active ingredient

label: to be treated with placebo role
definition: A study subject role which begins to exist when a subject is assigned to be one of those who will receive a placebo, and realized in a study execution in which they receive the placebo

label: reference subject role
definition: a reference subject  role which inheres in an organism or entity of organismal origin so that the characteristics or responses of the participant playing the reference participant role are used for comparison or reference

label: principal investigator role
definition: a responsible party role played by a person responsible for the overall conduct of a study

label: sponsor role
definition: a responsible party role involved with any of the following activities:  initiating, managing and funding a study

label: trial monitor role
definition: a responsible party involved in planning, overseeing the conduct of a study or study component, and interpreting data from a study

label: allotransplantation
definition: is the transplantation of organs between members of the same species.

label: autotransplantation
definition: is the transplantation of tissue from one part of \nthe body to another in the same individual. )

label: xenotransplantation
definition: is the transplantation of living cells, tissues or \norgans from one species to another such as from pigs to humans

label: material sample role
definition: A material sample role is a specimen role borne by a material entity that is the output of a material sampling process.

label: protein and DNA interaction identification objective
definition: A sequence feature identification objective that aims to characterize the interactions between protein and DNA which includes identification of transcription factor binding sites.

label: protein and RNA interaction identification objective
definition: A sequence feature identification objective that aims to characterize the interactions between protein and RNA.

label: compound treatment design
definition: an intervention design in which the treatment is the administration of a compound

label: growth condition intervention design
definition: A study design in which the independent variable is the environmental condition in which the specimen is growing

label: genetic modification design
definition: A study design in which an organism(s) is studied that has had genetic material removed, rearranged, mutagenized or added, such as in a knock out.

label: post-transcriptional modification design
definition: A study design in which a modification of the transcriptome, proteome (not genome) is made, for example RNAi, antibody targeting.

label: randomized complete block design
definition: A randomized complete block design is_a study design which assigns randomly treatments to block. The number of units per block equals the number of treatment so each block receives each treatment exactly once (hence the qualifier 'complete'). The design was originally devised from field trials used in agronomy and agriculture. The analysis assumes that there is no interaction between block and treatment. The method was then used in other settings So The randomised complete block design is a design in which the subjects are matched according to a variable which the experimenter wishes to control. The subjects are put into groups (blocks) of the same size as the number of treatments. The members of each block are then randomly assigned to different treatment groups.

label: repeated measure design
definition: a study design which use the same individuals and exposure them to a set of conditions. The effect of order and practice can be confounding factor in such designs

label: sequential design
definition: Any design in which the decision as to whether to enroll the next patient, pair of patients, or block of patients is determined by whether the cumulative treatment difference for all previous patients is within specified limits.  Enrollment is continued if the difference does not exceed the limits.  It is terminated if it does

label: stimulus or stress design
definition: A study design in which the response of an organism(s) to the stress or stimulus is studied, e.g. osmotic stress, heat shock, radiation exposure, behavioral treatment etc.

label: clinical research coordinator role
definition: a worker role comprised of handling the administrative duties of a trial or study.

label: contract research organization role
definition: a worker role of carrying out the study according to the protocol document or study plan delivered by the PI, under the control of the study director.  This role cannot make decisions about the study execution

label: health care provider role
definition: a worker role of providing medical care either within or outside the study timeline

label: material amplification role
definition: A worker role played by the person who runs the enzymatic amplifying process.

label: material sequencing library preparation role
definition: A worker role played by the person who performs the library preparation process to generate a sequencing library for a sample to be sequenced.

label: pathologist role
definition: a worker role of being responsible for making the histopathology diagnoses associated with data from a study; this activity occurs outside the study timeline

label: proxy respondent role
definition: Proxy respondent is a worker role of describing patient's symptoms or condition to medical personnel

label: role of pathology review board
definition: a worker role comprised of providing a confirmed and consensus diagnosis for histopathology results obtained during the investigation

label: sub-investigator role
definition: a worker role authorized to make study-related decisions and carry out tasks related to the study; this role occurs during the study timeline

label: trial statistician role
definition: a worker role that analyzes data obtained during a trial or study; this role occurs after the trial or study is completed or terminated.

label: DNA replication identification objective
definition: A molecular feature identification objective that aims to examine charateristics of DNA replication, such as replication time.

label: chromosome conformation identification objective
definition: A molecular feature identification objective that aims to determine spatial organization of chromatin.

label: epigenetic modification identification objective
definition: A molecular feature identification objective that aims to detect epigenetic modifications, such as DNA methylation, histone modifications.

label: transcription profiling identification objective
definition: A molecular feature identification objective that aims to characterize the abundance of transcripts

label: hardware optimization objective
definition: Hardware_optimization is a hardware_testing_objective describing a study designed to identify the best hardware.

label: hybridization oven
definition: A device that creates an appropriate environment for nucleic acid hybridization.

label: feed role
definition: a role that inheres in a material entity and is realized in the use of that material entity by lab animal to provide all needed nourishment.

label: single-end library
definition: A cDNA library that is a collection of short tags from only one end of DNA fragments.

label: microscopy assay
definition: An imaging assay that utilizes a microscope to magnify features of the visualized material of interest that are not visible to naked eye.

label: cohort role
definition: a cohort role is a biological replicate role played by a group of study participants who share a common characteristic of interest to the study.

label: reporting party role
definition: a study personnel role played by a party who reports the outcome of a study component

label: responsible party role
definition: a study personnel role played by a party who is accountable for the execution of a study component and can make decisions about the conduct of the study

label: specimen collector role
definition: An Investigation agent role borne by a person or organization which  is realized in a specimen collection process.

label: worker role
definition: a personnel role played by a party who executes a component of the study plan; this can occur before, during, after or outside the study timeline

label: complete nutrient role
definition: A nutrient role that inheres in a material entity and is realized in the use of that material entity by an organism to provide all needed nourishment.

label: hardware testing objective
definition: Hardware_testing_objective is a methodology_testing_objective role describing a study designed to examine the effects of using different hardware, e.g. scanner.

label: protocol testing objective
definition: Protocol_testing_objective is a methodology_testing_objective role describing a study designed to examine the effects of using different protocols.

label: software testing objective
definition: Software_testing_objective is a hardware_optimization role describing a study designed to examine the effects of using different software or software parameters, e.g. data processing software.

label: placebo role
definition: a negative reference substance is a reference role in which the substance playing the reference substance role is physically similar in appearance to the test substance

label: baseline participant role
definition: a reference participant role which is realized by making the reference to qualities at the start of the study or intervention

label: biological replicate role
definition: a reference participant role realized by equivalent treatment of participants

label: crossover population role
definition: a role realized when a participant serves as reference to itself

label: technical replicate role
definition: technical replicate role is realized when two portions from one evaluant are used in replicate runs of an assay

label: DNA cleavage, restriction analysis
definition: the use of enzymes to cut DNA molecules, the study of DNA through cleavage, mapping, and analysis of the fragments

label: non specific enzymatic cleavage
definition: a protocol application to digest the fraction of input material that is susceptible to that enzyme

label: protease cleavage
definition: protease cleavage is an enzymatic cleavage which relies on enzyme with protease activity to act on proteins and produce polypeptides (protein fragments).

label: specific enzymatic cleavage
definition: a protocol application to digest the fraction of input material that is susceptible to that enzyme

label: software optimization objective
definition: Software_optimization is a software_testing_objective role describing a study designed to identify the best software or parameters of the software.

label: hospital
definition: A medical organization at which sick or injured people are given clinical care

label: research organization
definition: An organization formed with a goal to have its members conduct investigations

label: Bioinformatics Resource Center
definition: An organization that  is one of the Internet-based research centers established and funded by NIAID (the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases). The Bioinformatics Resource Centers (BRCs) were formed in response to the threats posed by emerging and re-emerging pathogens, particularly CDC Category A, B, and C pathogens, and their potential use in bioterrorism. The intention of NIAID in funding these bioinformatics centers is to assist researchers involved in the experimental characterization of such pathogens and the formation of drugs, vaccines, or diagnostic tools to combat them.

label: courier organization
definition: An organization that delivers messages, packages, and mail.

label: grant agency
definition: An organization that provides funding support for projects such as investigations.

label: molecular analysis facility organization
definition: An organization that provides molecular analysis service.

label: organization of Bioinformatics Resource Center contact person
definition: An organization that is the affiliation of the person who is contact representative of a Bioinformatics Resource Center

label: organization of sequencing facility contact person
definition: An organization that is the affiliation of the contact representative at the sequencing facility

label: organization of specimen collector
definition: An organization that is the affiliation of the person collecting the specimen

label: organization of specimen provider principal investigator
definition: An organization that is the affiliation of the principal investigator providing the specimens for the investigation

label: regulatory agency
definition: A regulatory agency is a organization that has responsibility over or for  the legislation (acts and regulations) for a given sector of the government.

label: specimen repository organization
definition: An organization that provides a service to store and distribute specimens

label: cytological stain role
definition: A dye role that is realized when the stain is used to colour cells and or cellular components for the purposes of visualization

label: pH indicator dye role
definition: the role of a dye that is realized when the dye is used in an experiment to measure the pH in a material entity

label: vital dye role
definition: A dye role that is realized when used to detect live cells in an experiment

label: differential screening hybridization
definition: An artificially induced nucleic acid hybridization that is performed to identify differentially expressed genes through hybridization of cDNA probes.

label: suppression subtractive hybridization
definition: An artificially induced nucleic acid hybridization that is performed to compare gene expression in different cell or tissue types based on normalization and suppression, which creates a subtracted cDNA or genomic DNA library.

label: animal care protocol
definition: An animal care protocol is a protocol which specifies the environment in which animals are being kept in captivity for research purposes

label: notified body role
definition: Notified body is regulator of consumables and medical devices charged by the Competent Authority with verifying compliance of medical devices (not drugs) with the applicable Essential Requirements stated in the Medical Device Directive

label: role of being consumer safety officer
definition: the role of a human being that is realized by enforcing regulations to ensure consumer safety

label: administration of material to specimen
definition: The directed combination of a material entity with a specimen.

label: adding substance to cell culture
definition: is process in which a material substance is added to a cell culture

label: administering substance in vivo
definition: A process by which a substance is intentionally given to an organism resulting in exposure of the organism to that substance.

label: injection
definition: injection is process which aims at introducing a compound or a mixture into a material entity (either biological entity or instrument) by relying on devices such as syringe or injector connection, attached or forced into a vascular system (veins of an organism or tubes of a machine) or in a tissue.

label: transcription factor binding site identification by ChIP-Seq assay
definition: A transcription factor binding site assay that utilizes ChIP-seq technology.

label: transcription factor binding site identification by ChIP-chip assay
definition: A transcription factor binding site assay that utilizes ChIP-chip technology.

label: cloning vector role
definition: A material to be added role played by a small, self-replicating DNA or RNA molecule - usually a plasmid or chromosome - and realized in a process whereby foreign DNA or RNA is inserted into the vector during the process of cloning.

label: assigning gene property based on phenotypic assessment
definition: Interpreting data from assays that evaluate the qualities or dispositions inhering in an organism or organism part and comparing it to data from other organisms that have a defined genetic difference, and assigning a property to the product of the targeted gene as a result.

label: comparative phenotypic assessment
definition: Interpreting data from assays that evaluate the qualities or dispositions inhering in an organism or organism part and comparing it to data from other organisms to make a conclusion about a phenotypic difference

label: inductive reasoning
definition: a interpreting data that is used to ascribe properties or relations to types based on an observation instance (i.e., on a number of observations or experiences); or to formulate laws based on limited observations of recurring phenomenal patterns.

label: ion semiconductor chip
definition: An ion detector that is organized as an electronic circuit whose components, such as transistors and resistors, are etched or deposited on a single slice of semiconductor material to produce a chip. The specific chip detects ion charge induced when an ion passes by or hits a surface.

label: containing a specimen function
definition: A contain function that involves physical contact with a specimen. This function is typically performed in such a way that the specimen is usable for an investigation or assay.

label: filter function
definition: A filter function is a function to prevent the flow of certain entities based on a quality or qualities of the entity while allowing entities which have different qualities to pass through

label: sort function
definition: A sort function is a function to distinguish material components based on some associated physical quality or entity and to partition the separate components into distinct fractions according to a defined order.

label: light emission function
definition: A light emission function is an excitation function to excite a material to a specific excitation state that it emits light.

label: gas filter function
definition: A gas filter function is a filter function which prevents the flow of solid objects, defined by specific qualities, in a gas-solid mixture

label: liquid filter function
definition: A liquid filter function is a filter function which prevents the flow of solid objects, defined by specific qualities, in a liquid-solid mixture

label: cell transfer function
definition: is a transfer function that displaces cells from one place to another

label: pump function
definition: a transfer unction where the transfer requires work to move the entity, often against a gradient.

label: electricity supply function
definition: An electricity supply function is an energy supply function to transfer electricity from one source to another, typically a consumer of the electricity or as a stimulus during a neuroscience experiment.

label: display function
definition: A display function is a function to present information by translating that information through some lookup process into visual form.

label: signal conversion function
definition: A signal conversion function is an information processor function which transforms a signal into another type of signal. For example an analog-to-digital_converter, Ac/Ac converter, a synapse converts electrical action potentials into an intermediate chemical signal. The post synapse converts it back into an electric one passed on to the axon.

label: signal amplification function
definition: A signal amplification function is a signal conversion function to inject energy into an input signal so as to produce an output signal with increased differential magnitude while also seeking to minimize increases in the signal to noise ratio. For example, to produce a 0.1 KW output signal from a 1 mW RMS input signal.

label: SPECT scanner
definition: A nuclear medicine tomographic imaging device that uses gamma rays to provide 3D information, typically presented as cross-sectional slices through the specimen but with the ability to be freely reformatted or manipulated as required.

label: bead array reader
definition: A device that is used to acquire and image bead array data.

label: computed tomography scanner
definition: An image acquisition device that generates a three-dimensional image of the inside of an object from a large series of two-dimensional X-ray images taken around a single axis of rotation.

label: digital camera
definition: An image acquisition device that takes video or still photographs, or both, digitally by recording images via an electronic image sensor.

label: gel imaging system
definition: A device that is used to acquire images of laboratory gels.

label: immunoblot scanner
definition: A device that is used for the imaging of immunoblots.

label: infrared image acquisition device
definition: An image acquisition device that is responsive to an infrared emissive target within a given field of view.

label: positron emission tomography scanner
definition: A device that produces a three-dimensional image or picture of functional processes in the body. It detects pairs of gamma rays emitted indirectly by a positron-emitting radionuclide (tracer), which is introduced into the body on a biologically active molecule.

label: radiography instrument
definition: An image acquisition device that uses ionizing electromagnetic radiation such as X-rays to view objects.

label: small-animal image acquisition device
definition: A device that is used to image small laboratory animals (e.g., rats and mice) in vivo.

label: ultrasound machine
definition: A device that is used to visualize subcutaneous body structures including tendons, muscles, joints, vessels and internal organs.

label: array scanner
definition: An processed material which acquires images of fluorescence (induced with lasers) from labeled molecules on the surface of the microarray chip

label: image cytometer
definition: An image_cytometer is an instrument for image-based study or measurement of cells.

label: microscope
definition: A microscope is an instrument which magnifies the view on objects (too small to be viewed by the naked eye) under increased resolution. A microscope can be an optical instrument but also and electronic instrument. There are various kind of optical microscopes, e.g confocal microscope, epifluoresence microscope)

label: multispectral imaging flow cytometer
definition: A multispectral_imaging_flow_cytometer is an instrument which combines quantitative image analysis and flow cytometry in a single platform. It measures the amount, location and movement of molecules on, in, or between cells, and  the location and co-localization of multiple markers on or in cells. It can also quantitate morphologically distinct cell subpopulations.

label: multiplex ligation-mediated amplification
