label: material storage service
definition: A storage service in which a service consumer provides some material as input which a service provider stores and returns as output.

label: material analysis service
definition: A service in which a service consumer provides some input material and a service provider performs some analysis of this material to generate data that is returned to the service consumer.

label: material maintenance service
definition: A material processing service in which a service provider makes physical modifications to a specified input material, such that at least one of the specified outputs of this process is a modified version of a specified input material.

label: material processing service
definition: A service in which a service provider makes physical changes to a specified input material entity with the objective of producing a new material entity form input materials, or modifying the input material entity, and returning this as output to the service consumer.

label: material transport service
definition: A service in which a service provider facilitates the transport of some material entity to a specified destination for the service consumer.

label: data analysis service
definition: A service in which a service consumer provides some input data and a service provider transforms, models, or interprets the input data and returns this generated data as output.

label: data maintenance service
definition: A maintenance service in which a service provider actively manages or maintains data or a database for the service consumer.  Maintenance of the data is performed to maintain its integrity or enhance its quality or utility for the consumer, but new data is not generated as a result of the maintenance.

label: data storage service
definition: A storage service in which a service consumer provides data as input which a service provider stores and returns as output in its original form.

definition: A purified MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation and provides IC50 values determined under assay conditions where the IC50 approximates a KD value.

label: sequencing service
definition: A service provides sequencing service which is the realization of some sequencing such as RNA and DNA sequencing in which the service provider role is realized.

label: MHC protein complex binding to ligand
definition: The process in which a ligand binds to an MHC molecule to form a stable complex

label: core promoter binding
definition: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with the regulatory region composed of the transcription start site and binding sites for the basal transcription machinery. Binding may occur as a sequence specific interaction or as an interaction observed only once a factor has been recruited to the DNA by other factors.

label: immunoglobulin binding to epitope
definition: a process of an immunoglobulin complex binding to a material entity at the immunoglobulin complementarity determining region (CDR).

label: protein domain specific binding
definition: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific domain of a protein.

label: sequence-specific DNA binding
definition: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with DNA of a specific nucleotide composition, e.g. GC-rich DNA binding, or with a specific sequence motif or type of DNA e.g. promotor binding or rDNA binding.

label: MHC:epitope complex binding to TCR
definition: a process of an MHC molecule binding to an entity playing the role of epitope to create an MHC:epitope complex which is then bound by a TCR molecule.

label: Northwestern blot assay
definition: A direct binding assay that detects interactions of labeled RNA with immobilized protein on a membrane.

label: Southwestern blot assay
definition: A direct binding assay that detects interactions of labeled DNA with immobilized protein on a membrane.

label: antibody cross-blocking assay
definition: A competitive inhibition of binding assay in which two antibodies that are known to bind the same antigen are tested for the ability of one antibody to inhibit binding of the other antibody to the antigen, thereby determining if they have overlapping binding sites.

label: ELISA measuring epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells
definition: An assay of epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells that uses an ELISA.

label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells
definition: An assay of epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.

label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells
definition: An assay of epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

definition: An assay of epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.

label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells
definition: An assay of epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.

definition: A specimen identifier which is assigned by a sequencing facility

label: specimen identifier assigned by specimen repository
definition: A specimen identifier which is assigned by a specimen repository

label: high performance liquid chromotography assay
definition: An analytical chromatography assay that utilizes a high performance liquid chromatography instrument for separation of compounts in a solution.

label: immunocytochemistry
definition: An immuno staining assay in which samples of intact cells are examined that have had most, if not all, of their surrounding extracellular matrix removed

label: immunohistochemistry
definition: An immunostaining assay to detect and potentially localize antigens within the cells of a tissue section.

label: purified MHC molecule preparation
definition: A mixture containing MHC molecules that was purified to remove non-MHC molecular entities.

label: immunohistochemistry assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
definition: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that uses an immunohistochemistry assay.

label: bacterial one-hybrid assay
definition: An assay that identifies the sequence-specific target site of a DNA-binding domain. In this system, a given transcription factor (TF) is expressed as a fusion to a subunit of RNA polymerase. In parallel, a library of randomized oligonucleotides representing potential TF target sequences, is cloned into a separate vector containing the selectable genes HIS3 and URA3. If the DNA-binding domain (bait) binds a potential DNA target site (prey) in vivo, it will recruit RNA polymerase to the promoter and activate transcription of the reporter genes in that clone. The two reporter genes, HIS3 and URA3, allow for positive and negative selections, respectively. At the end of the process, positive clones are sequenced and examined with motif-finding tools in order to resolve the favoured DNA target sequence

label: chromosome organization assay by fluorescence in-situ hybridization
definition: An in-situ hybridization assay that uses fluorescence to detect chromosomal integrity

label: transcript expression location detection by hybridization chain reaction assay
definition: An in situ hybridization assay in which the location (e.g. anatomical/tissue) of a transcript is detected by a multiplexed fluorescent in situ hybridization, based on orthogonal amplification with hybridization chain reactions (HCR). RNA probes complementary to mRNA targets trigger chain reactions in which fluorophore-labeled RNA hairpins self-assemble into tethered fluorescent amplification polymers.
alternative_term: transcript expression location detection by fluorescent HCR.

definition: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that uses a disease exacerbation in vivo intervention experiment.

label: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific induction of hypersensitivity
definition: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that detects a hypersensitivity response by monitoring skin reactions.

label: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection from challenge
definition: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that uses a protection from challenge in vivo intervention experiment.

label: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection from fertility

label: eligibility criterion
definition: an eligibility criterion (rule) is_a selection criterion which  defines and states the requirements (positive or negative) for an entity to be considered as suitable for a given task or participation in a process.

definition: A T cell epitope specific interleukin-17F production assay that uses an ELISA.

definition: A T cell epitope specific interleukin-17F production assay that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.

definition: A T cell epitope specific interleukin-17A production assay that uses an ELISA.

label: individual-nucleotide resolution cross-linking and immunoprecipitation sequencing assay
definition: A cross-linking immunoprecipitation high-throughput sequencing assay that identifies protein-RNA interactions using UV light to covalently bind proteins and RNA molecules, allowing for a very stringent purification of the linked protein-RNA complexes.
alternative_term: iCLIP|individual-nucleotide resolution cross-linking and immunoprecipitation|iCLIP assay

label: nCounter Human miRNA Expression array
definition: A human array which is manufacutred by NanoString Technologies. Built upon color-coded molecular barcodes technology, the array profiles miRNA with increased specificity and sensitivty than microarrays.

label: nCounter Mouse miRNA Expression array
definition: A mouse array which is manufacutred by NanoString Technologies. Built upon color-coded molecular barcodes technology, the array profiles miRNA with increased specificity and sensitivty than microarrays.

label: Illumina BeadChip
definition: An array that consists of 3-micron silica beads that self assemble in microwells on either of two materials: fiber optic bundles or planar silica slides.

label: microarray
definition: A processed material that is made to be used in an analyte assay. It consists of a physical immobilisation matrix in which substances that bind the analyte are placed in regular spatial position.

label: cell line cell
definition: A cultured cell that is part of a cell line - a stable and homogeneous population of cells with a common biological origin and propagation history in culture

label: cell line immortalization
definition: an establishing cell line process whereby a mortal cell line is intentionally genetically modified to be capable of indefinite propagation and re-established as a new immortal cell line
alternative_term: 'establishing immortal cell line through directed genetic modification'

label: establishing cancer cell line
definition: is a planned process in which the objective is to generate a cell line from a natural population of cancer cells which are already immortal

label: 1M-Duo Infinium HD BeadChip
definition: A BeadChip which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation. Built upon BeadChip tehcnology, the array integrates ~ 1 million markers per sample for genotyping, and copy number variation (CNV) and Cytogenetic analysis.

label: Illumina Infinium Omni5Exome-4 Kit
definition: An Illumina BeadChip which is an array that interrogates over 4.3 million whole-genome variants for genotyping and copy number variation.

label: Illumina methylation BeadChip
definition: A BeadChip made for an analyte assay that generates information about DNA methylation.

label: Methylation 27K BeadChip
definition: A methylation BeadChip which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation. Built upon BeadChip tehcnology, the array interrogates ~ 27,000 CpG sites per sample at single-nucleotide resolution.

label: Methylation 450K BeadChip
definition: A methylation BeadChip which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation. Built upon BeadChip tehcnology, the array interrogates ~ 485,000 methylation sites per sample at single-nucleotide resolution.

label: Illumina Infinium MethylationEPIC BeadChip
definition: An Illumina methylation BeadChip which is an array that interrogates ~ 850,000 methylation sites per sample at single-nucleotide resolution.

label: cultured antigen presenting cell population
definition: a cell culture including cells that have an antigen presentation function

label: cultured effector T cell population
definition: A cell culture including cells that have an effector T cell function
alternative_term: culture of effector T cells|effector T cell culture sample

label: cultured CD3+ T cell population
definition: A T cell population characterized by expressing the CD3 molecule on its surface.

label: cultured CD3- T cell population
definition: A T cell population characterized by not expressing the CD3 molecule on its surface.

label: cultured CD4- T cell population
definition: A T cell population characterized by not expressing the CD4 molecule on its surface.

label: cultured CD8- T cell population
definition: A T cell population characterized by not expressing the CD8 molecule on its surface.

label: cultured PBMC cell population
definition: A mixed cell population obtained by processing whole blood. The cells are characterized by having a similar density and are largely mononuclear cells (includes T cells, B cells, and other cell types).

label: cell line culture
definition: A cell culture comprised of cell line cells and the media in which they are being actively propagated or quiescently stored.

label: primary cell culture
definition: A cell culture comprised of primary cultured cells and the media in which they are being actively propaged or quiescently stored.

label: DNA sequencing service
definition: A DNA sequencing  process provided as a service - which is the realization of some DNA sequencing in which the service provider role is realized.

label: cell line
definition: A cultured cell population that represents a genetically stable and homogenous population of cultured cells that shares a common propagation history (i.e. has been successively passaged together in culture).

label: RNA-binding protein immunoprecipitation tiling array profiling assay
definition: An RNA-binding protein immunoprecipitation array profiling assay that combines immunoprecipitation of an RNA-binding protein and RNA tiling array to identify mRNAs associated with selected RNA binding proteins (RBPs).

label: carbon-copy chromosome conformation capture assay followed by sequencing assay
definition: A carbon-copy chromosome conformation capture assay to analyze the organization of chromosomes in an unbiased, genome-wide manner using high throughput sequening following carbon-copy chromosome conformation capture.
alternative_term: Carbon-copy chromosome conformation capture assay followed by sequencing|HiC|HiC assay

label: Nanostring nCounter miRNA expression assay
definition: A microRNA profiling assay using digital molecular barcoding technology to quantify target microRNA molecules without the need for amplification.

label: microRNA profiling by array assay
definition: An assay that analyses the microRNA component of the transcriptome using a microRNA array.

label: microRNA profiling by high throughput sequencing assay
definition: A microRNA profiling assay that analyzes the microRNA component of the transcriptome using high throughput sequencing technology.

label: acquisition
definition: the planned process of gaining possession of a continuant

label: human subject enrollment
definition: A planned process with the objective to obtain a population of human subjects to participate in an investigation by determining eligibility of subjects and obtaining informed consent.

label: International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics cervical cancer stage value specification
definition: A categorical value specification that is an assessment of the stage of a gynecologic cancer according to the International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics (FIGO) staging systems.

label: International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics ovarian cancer stage value specification
definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of ovarian cancer following the rules of the FIGO classification system.
alternative_term: Pathologic Tumor Stage Grouping for ovarian cancer (FIGO)

label: clinical tumor stage group according to AJCC 7th edition
definition: A categorical value specification that is an assessment of the stage of a cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) v7 staging systems.

label: histologic grade according to AJCC 7th edition
definition: A categorical value specification that is a histologic grade assigned to a tumor slide specimen according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) 7th Edition grading system.

label: histologic grade according to the Fuhrman Nuclear Grading System
definition: A categorical value specification that is a histologic grade assigned to a tumor slide specimen according to the Fuhrman Nuclear Grading System.

label: histologic grade for ovarian tumor
definition: A categorical value specification that is a histologic grade assigned to a ovarian tumor.

label: pathologic distant metastases stage for colon according to AJCC 7th edition
definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of colon cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases. TNM pathologic distant metastasis findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.

label: pathologic distant metastases stage for kidney according to AJCC 7th edition
definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of renal cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases. TNM pathologic distant metastasis findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.

label: pathologic distant metastases stage for lung according to AJCC 7th edition
definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of lung cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases. TNM pathologic distant metastasis findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.

label: pathologic distant metastases stage for ovary according to AJCC 7th edition
definition: A categorical value specification that is a  pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of ovarian cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases. TNM pathologic distant metastasis findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.

label: pathologic lymph node stage for colon and rectum according to AJCC 7th edition
definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of colorectal cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of regional lymph nodes.
alternative_term: pN: Pathologic spread colon lymph nodes (AJCC 7th Edition)

label: pathologic lymph node stage for kidney according to AJCC 7th edition
definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of renal cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of regional lymph nodes.
alternative_term: pN: Pathologic spread kidney lymph nodes (AJCC 7th Edition)

label: pathologic lymph node stage for lung according to AJCC 7th edition
definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of lung cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of regional lymph nodes.
alternative_term: pN: Pathologic spread colon lymph nodes (AJCC 7th Edition)

label: pathologic lymph node stage for ovary according to AJCC 7th edition
definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of ovarian cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of regional lymph nodes.
alternative_term: pN: Pathologic spread ovarian lymph nodes (AJCC 7th Edition)

label: pathologic primary tumor stage for colon and rectum according to AJCC 7th edition
definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of colorectal cancer following the rules of the TNM American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) version 7 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor. TNM pathologic primary tumor findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.
alternative_term: pT: Pathologic spread colorectal primary tumor (AJCC 7th Edition)

label: pathologic primary tumor stage for kidney according to AJCC 7th edition
definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of renal cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor. TNM pathologic primary tumor findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.
alternative_term: pT: Pathologic spread kidney primary tumor (AJCC 7th Edition)

label: pathologic primary tumor stage for lung according to AJCC 7th edition
definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of lung cancer following the rules of the TNM American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) version 7 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor. TNM pathologic primary tumor findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.
alternative_term: pT: Pathologic spread lung primary tumor (AJCC 7th Edition)

label: pathologic primary tumor stage for ovary according to AJCC 7th edition
definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of ovarian cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor. TNM pathologic primary tumor findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.
alternative_term: pT: Pathologic spread ovarian primary tumor (AJCC 7th Edition)

label: performance status value specification
definition: A categorical value specification that is an assessment of a participant's performance status (general well-being and activities of daily life).

label: mass value specification
definition: A value specification that specifies the mass of some thing.

label: categorical value specification
definition: A value specification that is specifies one category out of a fixed number of nominal categories

label: scalar value specification
definition: A value specification that consists of two parts: a numeral and a unit label

label: RNA Integrity Number value specification
definition: A value specification that specifies the value of the RNA Integrity Number as a real value between 1 (most degraded) and 10 (most intact).

label: maximum age value specification
definition: A value specifcation that specifies the oldest age when specifying an age range.

label: minimum age value specification
definition: A value specifcation that specifies the youngest age when specifying an age range.

label: temperature value specification
definition: A value specification that specifies the temperature of some thing.

label: volume value specification
definition: A value specification that specifies the volume of some thing.

label: predicted mass value
definition: A predicted value where the prediction specifies the mass of some thing.

label: fluorescently labeled MHC multimer
definition: A complex of two or more linked MHC molecules including a fluorescent label that can be loaded with a ligand, and is used in flow cytometry assay to bind to T cell receptors of T cells specific for the ligand

label: labeled oligonucleotide
definition: a labeled oligonucleotide is a short nucleic acid which underwent a labeling process resulting in a radioactive isotope such as P32 or P33 added to its backbone for instance by end labeling with polynucleotide kinase which added radiolabeled ATP to the 5' end of oligonucleotide

label: contig N50
definition: N50 statistic computed for the contigs produced by the assembly process. A contig N50 is calculated by first ordering every contig by length from longest to shortest. Next, starting from the longest contig, the lengths of each contig are summed, until this running sum equals one-half of the total length of all contigs in the assembly. The contig N50 of the assembly is the length of the shortest contig in this list.

label: scaffold N50
definition: N50 statistic computed for the scaffold produced by the assembly process. The method for computing the value is similar to that of contig N50 but uses scaffold information instead of contig information

label: flash freezing
definition: A freezing process by which material entities are quickly frozen by subjecting them to cryogenic temperatures, or in direct contact with Liquid nitrogen at -320.8F or -196°C.

label: ChIP-chip assay
definition: An assay in which chromatin is immunoprecipitated and subsequently analyzed using a DNA microarray to identify which parts of DNA are part of the isolated chromatin

label: ChIP-qPCR assay
definition: A ChIP assay that uses quantitative PCR to determine levels of specific DNA in immunoprecipitated samples.

label: ChIP-seq assay
definition: An assay in which chromatin is immunoprecipitated and subsequently analyzed using a DNA sequencing step to identify which parts of DNA are part of the isolated chromatin

label: Ion 314 Chip v2
definition: An ion semiconductor chip manufactured by Life Technologies which detects polymerase-driven base incorporation to translate into digital form. The 314 chip is compatible with the Ion Torrent PGM and has a run time of:  2.3 hours for 200 bp reads with an output of 30-50 Mb, 3.7 hours for 400 bp reads with an output of 60-100 Mb.
alternative_term: Ion PGM 314 Chip|Ion PGM 314 Chip v2|Ion 314 Chip

label: Ion 316 Chip v2
definition: An ion semiconductor chip manufactured by Life Technologies which detects polymerase-driven base incorporation to translate into digital form. The 316 chip is compatible with the Ion Torrent PGM and has a run time of:  3.0 hours for 200 bp reads with an output of 30-50 Mb, 4.9 hours for 400 bp reads with an output of 60 Mb-1 Gb.
alternative_term: Ion PGM 316 Chip v2|Ion PGM 316 Chip|Ion 316 Chip

label: Ion 318 Chip v2
definition: An ion semiconductor chip manufactured by Life Technologies which detects polymerase-driven base incorporation to translate into digital form. The 318 chip is compatible with the Ion Torrent PGM and has a run time of:  4.4 hours for 200 bp reads with an output of 60 Mb-1 Gb, 7.3 hours for 400 bp reads with an output of 1.2 Gb-2 Gb.
alternative_term: Ion 318 Chip|Ion PGM 318 Chip|Ion PGM 318 Chip v2

label: cell proliferation assay
definition: A cytometry assay which measures the degreee to which input cells are replicating.

label: cell-cell binding detection by flow cytometry assay
definition: A binding assay which uses a flow cytometer to detect pairs of cells that are bound to each other by staining them with different fluorescent labels.

label: cell-cell killing assay
definition: A cytometry assay that monitors a cell population to track how many are killed by other cells.

label: comet assay
definition: An assay that measures DNA damage (DNA breakage) in eucaryotic cells exposed to a challenge by determining the size and shape of DNA migration by detecting fluorescently labeled DNA from a cell placed in an electric field using gel electrophoresis
alternative_term: SCGE assay|single cell gel electrophoresis assay

label: cytometry time of flight assay
definition: A cytometry assay in which the presence of molecules of interest on or in cells is indicated by binding of antibodies labeled with rare earth element tags which are detected by time-of-flight mass spectrometry.

label: enzyme-linked immunospot assay
definition: A cytometry assay in which cells are cultured on a surface coated with a capture antibody binding a secretory material of interest which subsequently gets stained resulting in a spot for each cell producing the secretory material of interest.

label: flow cytometry assay
definition: A cytometry assay in which an input cell population is put in solution, is passed by a laser, and optical sensors are used to detect scattering of the laser light and/or fluorescence of specific markers to count and characterize the particles in solution.

label: mixed lymphocyte reaction assay
definition: A cytometry assay where lymphocytes from two individuals are co-cultured with the lymphocytes from one of the allogeneic individuals (Responders) being labeled (with 3H Thymidine or BrdU) and the proliferation of the labeled cells is measured, which is thought to reflect recognition of histocompatibility antigens on the unlabeled cells (stimulators).

label: western blot analysis
definition: An analyte assay that detects specific peptides in an input material by separating it using gel electrophoresis, transfering the separated molecules to a membrane, and staining them with_ antibodies specific to the analyte molecules.

label: antibody binding detection by fluorescence quenching
definition: A binding assay in which affinity is measured by detecting a change in fluorescence (usually quenching) that occurs upon binding of the antibody to the ligand. The fluorescent signal that is affected by binding is either from an exogenous fluorophore attached to the ligand, or is the intrisic fluorescence of aromatic (tryptophan) residues on the binding site of the antibody (no conjugated fluorophore necessary) or, less commonly, on the ligand binding region (epitope).

label: disease exacerbation in vivo intervention experiment
definition: An in vivo intervention experiment that tests the ability of the intervention to increase the severity of a disease in the host.

label: protection from challenge in vivo intervention experiment
definition: An in vivo intervention experiment that tests the ability of the intervention to prevent occurrence of a disease in a host.

label: tolerance induction intervention experiment
definition: An in vivo intervention experiment that tests the ability of the intervention to decrease an immune response.

label: treatment intervention experiment
definition: An in vivo intervention experiment in which the ability of the intervention to reduce or cure the effects of a disease are tested.

label: RNA-binding protein immunoprecipitation array profiling assay
definition: An assay that combines immunoprecipitation of an RNA-binding protein and array technology to identify mRNAs associated with selected RNA binding proteins (RBPs).

label: RNAi profiling by array assay
definition: An assay in which double stranded RNA is synthesized with a sequence complementary to a gene(s) of interest and introduced into a cell or organism, where it is recognized as exogenous genetic material and activates the RNAi pathway resulting in knockdown of the transcripts and providing a means to study downstream changes in gene expression.

label: proteomic profiling by array assay
definition: An assay that detects proteins in a sample (quantified or otherwise analyzed), e.g. antibody profiling using an array based technology.

label: subcellular protein immunohistochemistry assay
definition: An immunohistochemistry assay that uses antibodies to display the specific subcellular location of proteins.

label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay measuring equilibrium association constant [KA] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding equilibrium association constant (KA) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect direct binding.

label: cell bound MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.

label: cell bound MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.

label: cell lysate MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
definition: A cell lysate MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.

label: purified MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
definition: A purified MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.

label: purified MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
definition: A purified MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.

label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex approximated by EC50 using fluorescence detection
definition: A purified MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding and provides EC50 values determined under assay conditions where the EC50 approximates a KD value.

label: purified MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex approximated by IC50 using radioactivity detection
definition: A purified MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation and provides IC50 values determined under assay conditions where the IC50 approximates a KD value.

label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay measuring half life of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
definition: A cell bound MHC ligand half life of binding determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.

label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay measuring half life of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
definition: A cell bound MHC ligand half life of binding determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to measure direct ligand binding.

label: cell lysate MHC direct binding assay measuring half life of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
definition: A cell lysate MHC ligand half life of binding determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to measure direct ligand binding.

label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring half life of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
definition: A purified MHC ligand half life of binding determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.

label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring half life of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
definition: A purified MHC ligand half life of binding determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to measure direct ligand binding.

label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay measuring half maximal effective concentration [EC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding half maximal effective concentration (EC50) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.

label: cell lysate MHC direct binding assay measuring half maximal effective concentration [EC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
definition: A cell lysate MHC ligand binding half maximal effective concentration (EC50) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to measure direct ligand binding.

label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring half maximal effective concentration [EC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
definition: A purified MHC ligand binding half maximal effective concentration (EC50) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.

label: cell bound MHC competitive binding assay measuring half maximal inhibitory concentration [IC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using T cell epitope recognition
definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) determination assay that uses a T cell epitope recognition assay to measure ligand binding.

label: cell bound MHC competitive binding assay measuring half maximal inhibitory concentration [IC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.

label: cell bound MHC competitive binding assay measuring half maximal inhibitory concentration [IC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.

label: purified MHC competitive binding assay measuring half maximal inhibitory concentration [IC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
definition: A purified MHC ligand binding half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.

label: purified MHC competitive binding assay measuring half maximal inhibitory concentration [IC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
definition: A purified MHC ligand binding half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.

label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay measuring the off rate [koff] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding off rate measurement (koff) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.

label: cell lysate MHC direct binding assay measuring binding off rate [koff] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection
definition: A cell lysate MHC ligand binding off rate measurement (koff) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to measure direct ligand binding.

label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring binding off rate [koff] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
definition: A purified MHC ligand binding off rate measurement (koff) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.

label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay measuring binding on rate [kon] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding on rate (kon) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.

label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring binding on rate [kon] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection
definition: A purified MHC ligand binding on rate (kon) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.

label: X-ray crystallography assay determining the 3D structure of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
definition: A T cell epitope 3D structure determination assay that uses an X-ray crystallography assay.

label: DNA methylation profiling assay
definition: An assay that measures the state of methylation of DNA molecules using genomic DNA collected from a material entity using a range of techniques and instrument such as DNA sequencers and often relying on treatment with bisulfites to ensure cytosine conversion.

label: micrococcal nuclease digestion followed by tiling array assay
definition: An array based nucleic acid structure mapping assay that identifies nucleosome positions genome wide, by detection of regions protected by nucleosomes from digestion by micrococal nuclease using tiling array assays

label: enhanced cross-linking immunoprecipitation high-throughput sequencing assay
definition: An iCLIP assay that is enhanced to robustly identify protein-RNA interactions with high efficiency through improvements in library preparation of RNA fragments.

label: X-ray crystallography assay determining the 3D structure of a MHC:ligand complex
definition: A MHC binding 3D structure determination of MHC molecule:epitope complex assay that uses an X-ray crystallography assay.

label: biological activity assay measuring T cell epitope specific in vivo activity
definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity determination assay that uses an in vivo intervention experiment.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific T cell activation
definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects T cell activation.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific T cell helper activity
definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects the ability of epitope specific helper T cells to enhance either B cell or T cell adaptive immune response function.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific T cell killing
definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects the killing of an antigen presenting cell (APC) by a T cell whose TCR recognizes an epitope presented by the APC.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific cytokine production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects cytokine production.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific cytotoxic T cell degranulation
definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects cytotoxic T cell degranulation.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells
definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects T cell proliferation.

label: in vitro assay measuring T cell epitope specific suppression
definition: T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects suppression of an in vitro response.

label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells
definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.

label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells
definition: An assay of epitope specific macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific oncostatin M production by T cells
definition: An assay of epitope specific oncostatin M production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

label: assay measuring the association constant [KA] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
definition: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the association constant KA.

label: assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
definition: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the dissociation constant KD.

label: assay measuring the off rate [koff] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
definition: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the off rate.

label: assay measuring the on rate [kon] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
definition: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the on rate.

label: 51 chromium assay measuring epitope specific T cell killing
definition: A T cell epitope specific killing assay performed in vitro that uses a chromium release assay.

label: 3H-thymidine assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay performed on cells in vitro that uses a tritiated thymidine incorporation assay.

label: BrdU assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay performed on cells in vitro that uses a BrdU incorporation assay.

label: carboxyfluorescein succinimidyl ester staining assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay performed on cells in vitro that uses a CFSE assay.

label: cell bound MHC binding assay measuring binding of a MHC:ligand complex
definition: A MHC binding qualitative binding to ligand assay measuring MHC ligand binding using MHC present on cells.

label: cell lysate MHC binding assay measuring binding of a MHC:ligand complex
definition: A MHC binding qualitative binding to ligand assay using MHC in a cell lysate.

label: purified MHC binding assay measuring binding of a MHC:ligand complex
definition: A MHC binding qualitative binding to ligand assay using MHC in a purified MHC molecule preparation.

label: in vivo assay measuring T cell epitope specific protection based on survival
definition: A T cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a protection from challenge in vivo intervention experiment based on survival.

label: in vivo assay measuring T cell epitope specific protection from infectious challenge based on pathogen burden
definition: A T cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a protection from challenge in vivo intervention experiment based on pathogen burden.

label: in vivo assay measuring T cell epitope specific protection from tumor challenge
definition: A T cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a protection from challenge in vivo intervention experiment based on tumor burden.

label: assay measuring MHC ligand processing and presentation
definition: A MHC ligand assay that determines what ligands are processed and loaded onto MHC molecules by eluting ligands and identifying them.

label: assay measuring binding of a MHC:ligand complex
definition: A MHC ligand assay that detects the binding of a ligand to an MHC molecule.

label: specimens collected in one encounter
definition: A collection of specimens that is collected from one source (e.g. one organism) during a time period which for the purpose of the study can be considered to be taken at the same sampling time.

label: specimens collected longitudinally
definition: A collection of specimens that was derived from the same source material entity at different time points in order to observe changes in that entity.

label: specimens derived from shared ancestor
definition: A collection of specimens derived from one common specimen via one or more material processing process(es).

label: human specimen set
definition: A specimen set that is collected from one person during a time period which for the purpose of the study can be considered to be taken at the same sampling time.

label: enhancer activity detection by reporter gene assay
definition: A reporter gene assay that detects expression of a reporter gene that was inserted under the control of an enhancer of interest.

label: Faraday cage
definition: A device formed by conducting material or by a mesh of such material, that blocks out external static electric fields.

label: bioreactor
definition: A device or system that supports a biologically active environment. ALAN SAYS NOT AN INSTRUMENT

label: incubator shaker
definition: An incubating device that provides shaking motion for biomedical applications (e.g., cell cultures).

label: vibration isolation table
definition: A device  that supports another device such as a precision instrument by isolating it from vibration that is transmitted from the floor.

label: gel dryer
definition: A gel dryer is a device which has the function to contain and to control the contained environment to facilitate the drying of gels

label: gel tank
definition: a device which holds a gel and running buffers to allow electrophoresis to be performed. A gel tank has the function to contain and to control the contained environment and transfer energy from an energy supply through the running buffers to the gel matrix and the material with charged molecules in an electric field across a porous matrix or medium with the objective to separate the charged molecules.

label: hybridization chamber
definition: A device which is used to maintain constant contact of a liquid on an array.  This can be either a glass vial or slide.

label: hybridization station
definition: A device which is used to maintain the temperature of one or more hybridization_chamber(s) at a defined, constant temperature.

label: incubator
definition: a device in which environmental conditions (light, photoperiod, temperature, humidity, etc.) can be controlled

label: isoelectric focusing device
definition: An isoelectric focusing device is a device in which isoelectric focusing can be performed. An isoelectric focussing device had the function to contain and control the contained environment and transfer electrical energy from a power supply to a separation medium and the charged material to be separated.

label: microarray platform
definition: A microarray platform is a platform that contains the instruments, software and reagents needed to perform a microarray protocol. definition_source: OBI.

label: microarray wash station
definition: a device that is used to wash Affymetrix-type arrays.

label: oligonucleotide synthesizer
definition: An instrument used to chemically synthesize oligonucleotides.

label: sheath tank
definition: Part of the fluidics system. The sheath tank is the vessel that holds the sheath fluid at a constant pressure, allowing for it to be pushed into the flow chamber at a constant rate. The sheath tank holds the pressurized sheath fluid.

label: temperature control bath
definition: A temperature_control_bath is a device that has the function to regulate the temperature of a material, the function to contain fluid and the function to vary and maintain the temperature of the contained fluid. Heat exchange (energy transfer) between the material and the heating element is facilitated via the contained fluid. A temperature_control_bath is composed of a container, a heating element and/or a cooling element and a means to adjust the needed temperature. In most cases also a timer and a means to stir the fluid is provided as well.

label: thermal cycler
definition: An instrument that is capable of repeatedly altering and maintaining specific temperatures for defined periods of time.

label: thermostatic circulator
definition: A thermostatic circulator is a device which cools or heats a circulating liquid. It has the function to contain control the contained environment and transfer energy from or to the circulating liquid

label: vacuum dryer
definition: An instrument which removes liquid by the application of negative pressure,  i.e. vacuum.

label: 3' rapid amplification of cDNA ends
definition: A rapid amplication of cDNA ends to amplify a mRNA sequence between a defined internal site and the 3' end of the mRNA.

label: 5' rapid amplification of cDNA ends
definition: A rapid amplication of cDNA ends to amplify a mRNA sequence between a defined internal site and the 5' end of the mRNA.

label: 5' RNA ligase mediated rapid amplification of cDNA ends
definition: A 5' rapid amplification pf cDNA ends that uses RNA ligase to add an RNA adapter oligonucleotide to intact 5' mRNA ends, allowing the amplification of cDNA only from full-length, capped mRNA.

label: plasmon resonance assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
definition: A T cell epitope equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses a surface plasmon resonance assay.

label: confocal fluorescence microscopy
definition: Microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce (emit energy as visible light) by scanning a gas (Ar or Kr) laser spot of specific wavelength over its surface and using a spatial pinhole to eliminate out-of-focus fluorescence.
alternative_term: fluorescence confocal scanning laser microscopy|confocal laser scanning microscopy|confocal-laser scanning microscopy|LSCM|confocal laser scanning fluorescence microscopy|confocal fluorescence imaging|scanning confocal fluorescence microscopy|CLSM|fluorescence confocal microscopy

label: electron microscopy imaging assay
definition: An imaging assay in which an electrons are used to probe the density, shape and composition of an input material which are detected in an electron microscope and utilized to produce an image of the material.

label: fluorescence microscopy
definition: Any type of microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce (emit energy as visible light) by illuminating it with light of specific wavelengths. These specimens are called fluorophores.

label: light microscopy
definition: Microscopy where the specimen is illuminated with visible light and a system of lenses is used to produce an image.

label: cytometric bead array assay measuring  epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells
definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.

label: CMV antibody assay
definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to cytomegalovirus (CMV) antigens.

label: EBV IgG antibody assay
definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect immunoglobulin G (IgG) antibodies that bind to Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) antigens.

label: EBV IgM antibody assay
definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect immunoglobulin M (IgM) antibodies that bind to Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) antigens.

label: HCV antibody assay
definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to Hepatitis C virus (HCV) antigens.

label: HIV antibody assay
definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) antigens.

label: HIV group O antibody assay
definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) group O antigens.

label: core HBV IgM antibody assay
definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detectimmunoglobulin M (IgM) antibodies that bind to hepatitis B virus (HBV) core antigens.

label: core HBV antibody assay
definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to hepatitis B virus (HBV) core antigens.

label: surface HBV antibody assay
definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to hepatitis B virus (HBV) surface antigens.

label: genomic SELEX
definition: A systematic evolution of ligands by exponential enrichment assay that starts with a library derived from genomic DNA instead of synthetically derived random DNA molecules.

label: DNAse footprinting assay
definition: An enzymatic footprinting assay that determines protein-binding sites on DNA by identifying bound fragments that are protected from DNAse I-catalyzed hydrolysis

label: hydrogen/deuterium exchange footprinting assay
definition: A footprinting assay that uses a chemical reaction whereby a covalently bonded hydrogen atom is replaced by a deuterium atom, or vice versa in order to gather information about the solvent accessibility of parts of a molecule and thus its tertiary structure.

label: hydroxyl-radical footprinting assay
definition: A footprinting assay that uses the reaction of hydroxyl radicals with side-chain sites in molecules (proteins, DNA, etc)_ with the resultant mass shift demonstrating the site of modification, used to_ to asses the accessibility of that site.

label: methidiumpropyl-EDTA-iron(II) footprinting assay
definition: A footprinting assay that determines protein-binding sites on DNA by partial cleavage of ligand-protected DNA restriction fragments with methidium-propyl-EDTA (MPE). MPE-Fe(II) in the presence of oxygen efficiently catalyzes the non-specific clevage of DNA.

label: subcellular protein localization assay
definition: A protein localization assay that determines the specific subcellular location of a protein. The location is visualized through electron microscopy.

label: tissue-based protein localization assay
definition: A protein localization assay that determines the specific location of a protein in a living tissue sample.

label: cell-attached patch clamp assay
definition: A patch-clamp assay where the electrode is left in place on the cell, and the membrane patch has been left intact been perforated. This maintains the separation of the interior of the pipette to the intracellular space of the cell. Measurements made with this technique involve recording currents through multiple channels simultaneously, over the membrane of the entire cell.

label: inside-out patch clamp assay
definition: A patch-clamp assay where a patch of the membrane is attached to the patch pipette, detached from the rest of the cell, and the cytosolic surface of the membrane is exposed to the external media, or bath. This provides the experimenter has access to the intracellular surface of the membrane via the bath and can manipulate the environment at the intracellular surface of single ion channels. For example, channels that are activated by intracellular ligands can then be studied through a range of ligand concentrations.

label: outside-out patch clamp assay
definition: A patch-clamp assay where a patch of the membrane is attached to the patch pipette. In this configuration, the external surface of the cell membrane is exposed as the outside of the membrane patch relative to the patch electrode. An outside-out patch starts with a gigaohm seal in a whole-cell recording configuration. The electrode is slowly withdrawn from the cell, until a fragment of membrane bulges away from the cell, which detaches and reforms as a convex membrane on the end of the electrode, with the original external surface of the membrane facing outward from the electrode. This provides the experimenter with access to the extracellular surface of the membrane via the bath and can manipulate the environment at the extracellular surface of single ion channels.

label: whole-cell patch clamp assay
definition: A patch-clamp assay where the electrode is left in place on the cell, as in cell-attached recordings, but the membrane patch has been perforated, providing access from the interior of the pipette to the intracellular space of the cell. Measurements made with this technique involve recording currents through multiple channels simultaneously, over the membrane of the entire cell.

label: cut open oocyte voltage clamp assay
definition: The cut-open oocyte Vaseline gap (COVG) voltage-clamp technique is designed to solve weaknesses in the two elextrode voltage clamp by maximizing the benefits of the Xenopus oocyte expression system by improving on clamp speed, signal-to-noise ratio, and ability to effectively perfuse the oocyte. In this way, it was possible to combine the most popular transient expression system, and the associated benefits of molecular cloning and site-directed mutagenesis, with the superior voltage-clamp properties of cut-open cell techniques.

label: two electrode voltage clamp assay
definition: The two electrode voltage clamp (TEVC) method utilizes two low-resistance pipettes, one sensing voltage and the other injecting current. The microelectrodes are filled with conductive solution and inserted into the cell to artificially control membrane potential. The membrane acts as a dielectric as well as a resistor, while the fluids on either side of the membrane function as capacitors.[9] The microelectrodes compare the membrane potential against a command voltage, giving an accurate reproduction of the currents flowing across the membrane. Current readings can be used to analyze the electrical response of the cell to different applications. This technique is mainly used in the Oocyte preparation.

label: Sakura Low profile Accu-Edge microtome blade
definition: A microtome blade that is manufactured by Feather and is disposable. The ultra-sharp blades section specimens without striations, distortion or chattering.

label: sequencing facility organization
definition: An organization that provides sequence determination service

label: cannot be assessed determination
definition: A reason for lack of data item that is the negative output of a determination if assay will provide reliable results.

label: GX
definition: A cannot be assessed determination for histologic tumor grade.

label: pNX
definition: A cannot be assessed determination of pathologic staging of lymph nodes.

label: pTX
definition: A cannot be assessed determination for pathologic primary tumor staging.

label: histologic grade for ovarian tumor according to a two-tier grading system
definition: A histologic grade for ovarian tumor that is from a two-tier histological classification of tumors.

label: histologic grade for ovarian tumor according to the World Health Organization
definition: A histologic grade for ovarian tumor that is from a histological classification by the World Health Organization (WHO).

label: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group score value specification
definition: A performance status value specification designed by the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group to assess disease progression and its affect on the daily living abilities of the patient.

label: Karnofsky score vaue specification
definition: A performance status value specification designed for classifying patients 16 years of age or older by their functional impairment.

label: aunt clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in the female sibling of a parent.

label: brother clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male sibling.

label: daughter clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a person's female child.

label: father clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male parent.

label: grandfather clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male parent of a parent.

label: grandmother clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female parent of a parent.

label: mother clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female parent.

label: nephew clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male child of a sibling.

label: niece clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female child of a sibling.

label: sister clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female sibling.

label: son clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a person's male child.

label: uncle clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male sibling of a parent.

label: diagnosis of HIV
definition: A diagnosis of infectious disease caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (1 or 2).

label: diagnosis of hepatitis B
definition: A diagnosis of infectious disease caused by the hepatitis B virus.

label: diagnosis of hepatitis C
definition: A diagnosis of infectious disease caused by the hepatitis C virus.

label: exposure to second hand smoke in current household
definition: An exposure to second hand smoke in person's current household.

label: exposure to second hand smoke in household during childhood
definition: An exposure to second hand smoke that occurred in the (patient's) household when the person was a child.

label: hysterectomy history
definition: A gynecologic surgery history in which a woman has had a hysterectomy.

label: neither hysterectomy nor oophorectomy history
definition: A gynecologic surgery history in which a woman has not had either a hysterectomy or an oophorectomy.

label: unilateral oophorectomy history
definition: A gynecologic surgery history in which a woman has had a unilateral oophorectomy.

label: hormonal birth control current use history
definition: A hormonal birth control use history that indicates an individual is currently a hormonal birth control user.

label: hormonal birth control former use history
definition: A hormonal birth control use history that indicates an individual has previously been a hormonal birth control user but is not a current user.

label: no hormonal birth control use history
definition: A hormonal birth control use history that indicates an individual has not ever been a hormonal birth control user.

label: cream delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy
definition: A delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy that is a cream for transdermal administration.

label: patch delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy
definition: A delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy that is a patch for transdermal administration.

label: pill delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy
definition: A delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy that is a pill for oral administration.

label: indeterminate menopausal status
definition: A menopausal status that is neither pre- nor post-menopausal.

label: perimenopausal status
definition: A menopausal status indicating that it has been 6-12 months since last menstrual period.

label: postmenopausal status
definition: A menopausal status indicating that it has been more than 12 months since the last menstrual period with no prior hysterectomy or that there has been a prior bilateral oophorectomy.

label: premenopausal status
definition: A menopausal status indicating that less than 6 months has passed since the last menstrual period and there has not been prior bilateral oophorectomy and not on estrogen replacement.

label: exposure to arsenic history
definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is arsenic.

label: exposure to asbestos history
definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is asbestos.

label: exposure to chromium history
definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is chromium.

label: exposure to diesel exhaust history
definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is diesel exhaust.

label: exposure to silica history
definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is silica.

label: chromatin interaction analysis by paired-end tag sequencing assay
definition: An assay that incorporates chromatin immunoprecipitation (ChIP)-based enrichment, chromatin proximity ligation, Paired-End Tags, and high-throughput sequencing to determine de novo long-range chromatin interactions genome-wide.

label: chromosome conformation capture assay
definition: A nuclear ligation assay that detects chromosomal interactions between any two genomic loci. Chromatin segments are cross-linked, cut by restriction enzymes, ligated, and finally analyzed by PCR.

label: chromosome conformation capture-on-chip assay
definition: A nuclear ligation assay which uses cross-linking of proteins to proteins and DNA, followed by two rounds of digestion and ligation, inverse PCR, and characterization by microarray or DNA sequencing. This enables unbiased genome-wide screens for DNA contacts made by single genomic sites of interest.
alternative_term: circularized chromosome conformation capture assay|4C assay

label: Hi-C assay
definition: A chromosome conformation capture assay that detects genome-wide chromosomal interactions. High-throughput techniques are used to sequence the ligated fragments after cross-linking and cutting with restriction enzymes.

label: analyte role
definition: A measurand role borne by a molecular entity or an atom and realized in an analyte assay which achieves the objective to measure the magnitude/concentration/amount of the analyte in the entity bearing evaluant role.

label: hydrogen/deuterium exchange assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
definition: A footprinting assay that uses hydrogen/deuterium exchange to measure B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody.

label: hydroxyl-radical footprinting assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
definition: A footprinting assay that uses hydroxyl-radical footprinting to measure B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody.

label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interferon-alpha production by T cells
definition: An assay of epitope specific interferon-alpha production by T cells that uses an ELISA.

label: verse algorithm
definition: An alignment counting algorithm that assigns gene features to genomic alignments using a hierarchical assignment scheme, which allows simultaneous quantification of multiple feature types or annotation levels without repeatedly assigning reads.

label: bcl2fastq software application
definition: A base calling application that implments a base calling algorithm to convert BCL (binary base call) files generated by Illumina sequencing systems to standard FASTQ file formats for downstream analysis.

label: star algorithm
definition: A reference genome transcriptome alignment algorithm that is a standalone RNA-seq alignment algorithm that uses uncompressed suffix arrays and a mapping algorithm similar to those used in large-scale genome alignment tools to align RNA-seq reads to a genomic reference.

label: adapter-sequence trimming
definition: A data transformation in which adapter sequences at the end of a molecular sequence are cut (removed).

label: supervised machine learning
definition: A machine learning process using a function that maps an input to an output based on example input-output pairs. It infers a function from labeled training data consisting of a set of training examples.

label: unsupervised machine learning
definition: A machine learning process that infers a function describing the structure of "unlabeled" data (i.e. data that has not been classified or categorized).

label: chimera
definition: An organism which contains cells or tissues with a different genotype

label: host of immune response
definition: An organism in which an immune response process occurs.

label: infectious agent
definition: is a material entity bearing the disposition to infect an organism

label: selectively maintained organism
definition: An organism that is bred to have some uniform behavioral, morphological, physiological, or genetic characteristics with similarly bred organisms

label: cloacal specimen
definition: A specimen obtained by inserting a swab deeply into the vent of the cloaca of an organism and vigorously swabbing the wall. The swab should be deeply stained with fecal material and is then placed in transport medium.

label: material sample
definition: A material entity that has the material sample role

label: nasal swab specimen
definition: A specimen obtained using a cotton swab on a stick, passed up the nostril to obtain a sample of exudate and epithelial debris for microbiological or cellular examination.

label: nasopharyngeal aspirate specimen
definition: A speciemn which derives from nasopharyngeal mucosa after aspiration.

label: whole organism preparation
definition: A material entity which is the output of a process in which one or more whole organisms are prepared in a way to make it easier to study them, and in which the great majority of organismal parts are maintained

label: bronchial alveolar lavage
definition: Group of biomaterials present in the bronchial aveolar space of an organism which are collected through lavage including the reagents used to for the lavage process, organisms, cells, and cellular secretions present in the bronchial aveolar space.

label: cell specimen
definition: A specimen primarily composed of a cell or cells collected from a multicellular organism or a cell culture.

label: specimen from organism
definition: A specimen that derives from an anatomical part or substance arising from an organism. Examples of tissue specimen include tissue, organ, physiological system, blood, or body location (arm).

label: specimen with known storage state
definition: A specimen for which it is known whether it has been subjected to storage of a specified type.

label: specimen with pre- or post-mortem status
definition: A specimen that has been established to be taken from a live (pre-mortem) or dead (post-mortem) organism.

label: secondary cultured cell population
definition: A cultured cell population that is derived through one or more passages in culture.

label: cultured adherent cell populaiton
definition: A mixed cell population that is characterized by its ability to bind to tissue culture flasks or plates. This population typically contains macrophages and other cells capable of playing the antigen presenting cell role.

label: cultured clonal cell population
definition: A cultured cell population comprised of cells which can all be traced back to a single ancestor cell, and which therefore can be treated as identical.

label: cultured immune cell population
definition: a cultured cell population comprised of a single type of immune system cell

label: primary cultured cell population
definition: A cultured cell population comprised of cells expanded directly from living tissue prior to being passaged.
alternative_term: primary cell culture sample|primary cell culture

label: ANOVA
definition: ANOVA or analysis of variance is a data transformation in which a statistical test of whether the means of several groups are all equal.

label: Likelihood-ratio test
definition: Likelihood-ratio is a data transformation which tests whether there is evidence of the need to move from a simple model to a more complicated one (where the simple model is nested within the complicated one); tests of the goodness-of-fit between two models.

label: MA transformation
definition: An MA transformation is a data transformation which takes as input a collection of data points (g_1, r_1), (g_2, r_2), ..., (g_n, r_n)  with the r_i and g_i positive real numbers, and whose output is the collection of data points (A_1, M_1), (A_2, M_2), ..., (A_n, M_n) where, for each i, A_i=(log(g_i)+log(r_i))/2 and M_i=log(r_i)-log(g_i). Here log denotes a logarithmic transformation.

label: feature extraction
definition: A planed process with objective of obtaining quantified values from an image.

label: file merge
definition: A data transformation in which data contained in 2 or more files are merged into a single file.

label: peak matching
definition: Peak matching is a data transformation performed on a dataset of a graph of ordered data points (e.g. a spectrum) with the objective of pattern matching local maxima above a noise threshold

label: performing a diagnosis
definition: The interpretation of the information available about bodily features (clinical picture) of a patient resulting in a diagnosis

label: sequence trimming
definition: A data transformation in which subsequences of a molecular sequence are cut (removed).

label: survival analysis data transformation
definition: A data transformation which has the objective of performing survival analysis.

label: RNA Integrity Number calculation
definition: A data transformation using the RIN algorithm to generate a quality measure of RNA based on features from an electrophoretic trace.

label: averaging data transformation
definition: An averaging data transformation is a data transformation that has objective averaging.

label: background correction data transformation
definition: A background correction data transformation (sometimes called supervised classification) is a data transformation that has the objective background correction.

label: center calculation data transformation
definition: A center calculation data transformation is a data transformation that has objective of center calculation.

label: class discovery data transformation
definition: A class discovery data transformation (sometimes called unsupervised classification) is a data transformation that has objective class discovery.
alternative_term: clustering data transformation|unsupervised classification data transformation

label: class prediction data transformation
