The Aria has the filters and PMTs to collect side scatter and 9 fluorescent parameters. The Aria has a photodiode detector for forward scatter collector. The flow cell is Quartz cuvette. The FACSAria is a sorter used to collect and analyse cells using up to 11 parameters.

label: FACSvantage
definition: The FACSvantage is a flow_cytometer_sorter manufactured by Becton Dickinson. It has analog electronics, three lasers (several options are available), and the filters and PMTs to collect 6 fluorescent parameters and side scatter, and a photodiode to collect forward scatter. The FACSvantage can be used to analyse, sort and collect cells.

label: Influx Cell Sorter
definition: A Influx Cell Sorter is a flow_cytometer_sorter manufactured by Cytopeia. It is a digital machine, with these laser options: Coherent 70, 90, 300 series water cooled lasers, solid state UV 355nm, Violet 408nm, Violet-Blue 479nm, Blue-488nm, Green-531nm, Red-635nm, Red-647nm. The sorting is multi-way, index, and proportional sorting. Filters and PMTs are used for all parameters (including forward light scatter), and up to 12 PMTs can be included. The Influx cell sorter can be used to measure, sort, and collect ndividual cells.

label: LSR2
definition: A LSR2 is a sorter manufactured by Becton Dickinson. It features digital electronics, a solid state 488 nm blue laser and optionally can also have any combination of solid state UV (355 nm) and violet (405 nm) lasers and the a HeNe (633 nm) ion laser. The LSR2 has the filters and PMTs to work with 13 fluorescent parameters. The LSR II is one of the most common sorters in use.

label: MoFlo
definition: A MoFlo is a flow_cytometer_sorter manufactured by Dako Cytomation. It features digital electronics, the option to include several lasers (solid state 488 nm, 635 nm, and a 351 nm diode laser), and has the filtering and collection capacity for up to 10 flouresecent parameters. The MoFlo is an instrument that can be used to both analyze quantitatively and collect cells in a flowing medium.

label: Reflection
definition: A Reflection is a sorter manufactured by iCyte. It uses digital signal processing, and can be configured with lasers of the users choice from among these excitation wavelengths: 355, 405,488, 532, 635nm. It accommodates up to 48 traditional PMTs. Options include an acousto-optical tunable filter (AOTF) and 16 channel spectrometer (370 to 730 nm). The various detection components can be uniquely configured across multiple Highly Automated Parallel Sorting (HAPS) modules. The Reflection can be used to analyse, sort, and collect cells.

label: logarithmic voltage amplifier
definition: A logarithmic voltage amplifier is an analog electronic circuit that puts out a voltage or current proportional to the voltage or current at its input, with logarithmic proportionality. In an analog system, the logarithmic voltage amplifier is used to present parameters with a high dynamic range on a more useful scale.

label: preamplifier
definition: A preamplifier is part of the electronics subsystem. It converts the current output from its associated detector to a voltage. The preamplifier is the first stage in analog electronics signal processing.

label: 454 Genome Sequence 20
definition: is a DNA sequencer which is manufactured by 454 Life Science Corporation and enables pyrosequencing to be performed. It comprises both optics and fluidics subsystems, which are controlled by a computer subsystem. The fluidics subsystem ensures accurate reagent dispensing. It consists of a reagents cassette (which holds the reagent containers), a sipper manifold, pumps, valves, and debubblers. The fluidics subsystem flows the sequencing reagents across the wells of the PicoTiterPlate device, and moves the spent reagents from the PicoTiterPlate device to the waste receptacle. The optics subsystem consists of a CCD camera and a camera controller. The camera captures the light emitted in the wells of the PicoTiterPlate device during each step of the sequencing cycle, and sends the digital images to the computer subsystem for processing. The computer controls the other Sequencer subsystems, and processes the digital images sent by the camera to extract the DNA sequence information.

label: 454 Genome Sequencer FLX
definition: is a DNA sequencer which is manufactured by 454 Life Science Corporation and enables pyrosequencing to be performed. It comprises both optics and fluidics subsystems, which are controlled by a computer subsystem. The fluidics subsystem ensures accurate reagent dispensing. It consists of a reagents cassette (which holds the reagent containers), a sipper manifold, pumps, valves, and debubblers. The fluidics subsystem flows the sequencing reagents across the wells of the PicoTiterPlate device, and moves the spent reagents from the PicoTiterPlate device to the waste receptacle. The optics subsystem consists of a CCD camera and a camera controller. The camera captures the light emitted in the wells of the PicoTiterPlate device during each step of the sequencing cycle, and sends the digital images to the computer subsystem for processing. The computer controls the other Sequencer subsystems, and processes the digital images sent by the camera to extract the DNA sequence information.

label: AB SOLiD System
definition: is a DNA sequencer which is manufactured by Applied Biosystems and which enable DNA sequencing by ligation

label: ABI 377 automated sequencer
definition: is a DNA sequencer which is manufactured by Applied Biosystems corporation (formerly Perkin-Elmer). It allows automated chain termination DNA sequencing. It has part polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis system and a laser -based detection system to detect fluorescence intensity emitted by the dyes attached to the dideoxyterminator nucleotides or to the primers.

label: HeliScope Single Molecule Sequencer
definition: is a DNA sequencer manufacturer by Helicos Corporation to carry out Single Molecule sequencing using reversible termination chemistry

label: Illumina Genome Analyzer II
definition: is a DNA sequence which is manufactured by Illumina (Solexa) corporation. it support sequencing of single or paired end clone libraries relying on sequencing by synthesis technology

label: Illumina HiSeq 1000
definition: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation, with a single flow cell and a throughput of up to 35 Gb per day. It supports sequencing of single, long or short insert paired end clone libraries relying on sequencing by synthesis technology.

label: Illumina HiSeq 2000
definition: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation, with two flow cells and a throughput of up to 55 Gb per day. Built upon sequencing by synthesis technology, the machine is optimized for generation of data for multiple samples in a single run.

label: Illumina HiSeq 2500
definition: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation, with two flow cells and a throughput of up to 160 Gb per day. Built upon sequencing by synthesis technology, the machine is optimized for generation of data for batching multiple samples or rapid results on a few samples.

label: Illumina HiSeq 3000
definition: A DNA sequencer manufactured by Illumina corporation, with a single flow cell and a throughput of more than 200 Gb per day.

label: Illumina HiSeq 4000
definition: A DNA sequencer manufactured by Illumina corporation, with two flow cell and a throughput of more than 400 Gb per day.

label: Li-Cor 4300 DNA Analysis System
definition: is a DNA sequencer which is manufactured by Li-Cor corporation and enable automated chain termination based DNA sequencing

label: MiSeq
definition: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation. Built upon sequencing by synthesis technology, the machine provides an end-to-end solution (cluster generation, amplification, sequencing, and data analysis) in a single machine.

label: NextSeq 500
definition: A DNA sequencer which is a desktop sequencer ideal for smaller-scale studies manufactured by the Illumina corporation. It supports sequencing of single, long or short insert paired end clone libraries relying on sequencing by synthesis technology.

label: PacBio RS II
definition: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Pacific Biosciences corporation. Built upon single molecule real-time sequencing technology, the machine is optimized for generation with long reads and high consensus accuracy.

label: Illumina Genome Analyzer
definition: A DNA sequencer manufactured by Solexa as one of its first sequencer lines, launched in 2006, and capable of sequencing 1 gigabase (Gb) of data in a single run.

label: Illumina HiSeq X Ten
definition: A DNA sequencer that consists of a set of 10 HiSeq X Sequencing Systems.

label: microcentrifuge
definition: A type of centrifuge that is designed for small tubes (0.2 ml to 2.0 ml), has a compact design, and has a small footprint.

label: computer cluster
definition: A group of linked computers, working together closely so that in many respects they form a single computer.

label: acquisition computer
definition: A Computer used for NMR, can be divided into central processing unit (CPU), consisting of instruction, interpretation and arithmetic unit plus fast access memory, and peripheral devices such as bulk data storage and input and output devices (including, via the interface, the spectrometer). Under software control, the computer controls the RF pulses and gradients necessary to acquire data, and process the data to produce spectra or images. Note that devices such as the spectrometer may themselves incorporate small computers.

label: liquid extraction robot
definition: A liquid handling device that provides automatic liquid extraction.

label: DNA synthesizer
definition: An oligonucleotide synthesizer that is used to custom-build DNA molecules to contain a particular sequence of nucleotides.

label: electron paramagnetic resonance spectrometer
definition: An spectrophotometer that is used to investigate chemical species that have one or more unpaired electrons, such as organic and inorganic free radicals or inorganic complexes possessing a transition metal ion.

label: LactoScope C4
definition: A LactoScope_C4 is a spectrophotometer with which the composition of milk and milk products is analysed via infrared technology. The LactoScope determines the amount of the constituents fat, protein, lactose and the total solids content with extreme accuracy.

label: fluorometer
definition: A fluorometer is an instrument for the detection and measurement of parameters of fluoresence, which in turn are used to identify the presence and amount of specific molecules in the sample.

label: PCR instrument
definition: A device that is used to amplify a single or few copies of a piece of DNA across several orders of magnitude, generating thousands to millions of copies of a particular DNA sequence.

label: oil bath
definition: An oil bath is a temperature control bath in which oil acts as contact medium for the temperature transfer (from heating or cooling elements to the sample).

label: water bath
definition: A water bath is a temperature control bath in which a water acts as contact medium enabling temperature transfer from the heating element or cooling element to the sample. The temperature can be controlled in the 0 to 100 degree centigrade range (under normal pressure).

label: flow cytometer
definition: A flow_cytometer is an instrument for counting, examining and sorting microscopic particles in suspension. It allows simultaneous multiparametric analysis of the physical and/or chemical characteristics of single cells flowing through an optical and/or electronic detection apparatus. A flow cytometer is an instrument that can be used to quantitatively measure the properties of individual cells in a flowing medium.

label: portable fluorometer
definition: A compact fluorometer that can be carried or moved with ease.

label: Amnis ImageStream
definition: The ImageStream is a multispectral_imaging_flow_cytometer manufactured by Amnis. Its has digital electronics, a single standard 488 nm solid state laser. In addition an optional 658 nm and your choice of either a 405 nm or 375 nm solid state laser can be added. Information is collected using cameras. The ImageStream system CCD camera produces six images of each cell, including darkfield, brightfield, and up to four fluorescent colors. Each image is used to calculate over 40 features, so a six-image assay results in ~250 morphometric and photometric features per cell. The ImageStream is a flow cytometer that takes pictures of the cells in flow. It has both components, an Image cytometer and a flow cytometer.

label: DNA microarray
definition: A DNA-microarray is a microarray that is used as a physical 2D immobilisation matrix for DNA sequences. DNA microarray-bound DNA fragments are used as targets for a hybridising probed sample.

label: protein microarray
definition: A protein-microarray is a microarray, ususlly a piece of glass, on which different molecules of protein have been affixed at separate locations in an ordered manner. These are used to identify protein-protein or protein-small molecule interactions.

label: SNP microarray
definition: a DNA microarray used to detect polymorphisms in DNA samples

label: tiling microarray
definition: a DNA microarray which has short fragments of nucleic acid immobilized on a substrate. These are designed to cover the whole genome of the target species. Tiling arrays are used to determine genome binding in ChIP assays or to identify transcribed regions.

label: Microm Ergostar HM200
definition: A microtome that is manufactured by Microm and uses a vertical cutting stroke common to all rotary microtomes engaged by a horizontal sliding movement. An operating arm replaces the handwheel and is attached to both sides of the instrument for greater convenience to permit control of sectioning from the left or right.

label: confocal microscope
definition: A microscope that is used to increase micrograph contrast and/or reconstruct three-dimensional images by using a spatial pinhole to eliminate out-of-focus light in specimens that are thicker than the focal plane.

label: digital microscope
definition: A microscope that uses optics and a charge-coupled device (CCD) camera to output a digital image to a monitor.

label: electron microscope
definition: A microscope that produces an image of an object by targeting it with an electron beam

label: laser capture microdissection microscope
definition: A microscope that uses low-energy laser beams and special transfer film to lift single cells from a tissue.

label: optical microscope
definition: A microscope that produces an image of an object by targeting it with an electro-magnetic beam in the visible frequency range

label: scanning force microscope
definition: A microscope that forms images of surfaces using a physical probe that scans the specimen.

label: decision analysis study design
definition: a study design that has a decision analysis objective specification as part

label: proteomic profiling design
definition: A study design in which proteins in a sample are detected, quantified or otherwise analysed.

label: systematic review study design
definition: A study design for identifying in the literature prior studies of a pre-determined phenomenon or set of related phenomena according to certain criteria, extracting findings from these studies, and summarizing these findings and/or attempting to draw new conclusions from them which were not justified by any of the individual, prior studies. Many systematic reviews also assess the quality of the studies so reviewed.

label: DNA methylation profiling by array design
definition: A study design in which the methylation state of DNA is determined and is compared between samples using array technology.

label: DNA methylation profiling by high throughput sequencing design
definition: A study design in which the methylation state of DNA is determined and is compared between samples using high throughput sequencing technology.

label: RNA stability design
definition: A study design that examines the stability and/or decay of RNA transcripts.

label: RNAi profiling by array design
definition: A study design in which experiment double stranded RNA is synthesized with a sequence complementary to a gene(s) of interest and introduced into a cell or organism, where it is recognized as exogenous genetic material and activates the RNAi pathway resulting in knockdown of the transcripts and providing a means to study downstream changes in gene expression.

label: all pairs design
definition: A study design in which all specimens are compared to every other specimen.

label: array platform variation design
definition: A study design in which the array platform is compared, e.g. Agilent versus Affymetrix.

label: cell component comparison design
definition: A study design that compares samples from different cell components.

label: cell cycle design
definition: A study design that assays events that occur in relation to the cell cycle, which is the period between the formation of a cell, by division of its mother cell and the time when the cell itself divides to form two daughter cells.

label: cell differentiation design
definition: A study design that assays events associated with cell development or differentiation.

label: cell type comparison design
definition: A study design that compares cells of different type, for example different cell lines.

label: cellular process design
definition: A study design that aims to study the processes that are carried out at the cellular level, but are not necessarily restricted to a single cell. For example, cell communication occurs among more than one cell, but occurs at the cellular level.

label: clinical history design
definition: A study design that the organism's clinical history of diagnosis, treatments, e.g. vaccinations, surgery etc. is studied.

label: clinical study design
definition: Plan for the precise procedure to be followed in a clinical trial, including planned and actual timing of events, choice of control group, method of allocating treatments, blinding methods; assigns a subject to pass through one or more epochs in the course of a trial. Specific design elements, e.g., crossover, parallel; dose-escalation [Modified from Pocock, Clinical Trials: A Practical Approach]

label: comparative genome hybridization by array design
definition: A study design that detects genomic copy number variations using microarray technology.

label: disease state design
definition: A study design in which the pathological condition of a part, organ, or system of an organism is studied. The etiology may be from infection, genetic defect, or environmental stress.

label: dye swap design
definition: An experiment design type where the label orientations are reversed. exact synonym: flip dye, dye flip

label: environmental history design
definition: A study design in which some aspect of the organism's environmental history is studied, such as exposure to teratogen, radiation, climate etc.

label: ex vivo design
definition: A study design where all or part of an organism is removed and studied in vitro, e.g. part of a mouse is removed and cultured in vitro. A cell culture with an established cell line is an in vitro experiment.

label: factorial design
definition: factorial design is_a study design which is used to evaluate two or more factors simultaneously. The treatments are combinations of levels of the factors. The advantages of factorial designs over one-factor-at-a-time experiments is that they are more efficient and they allow interactions to be detected. In statistics, a factorial design experiment is an experiment whose design consists of two or more factors, each with discrete possible values or levels, and whose experimental units take on all possible combinations of these levels across all such factors. Such an experiment allows studying the effect of each factor on the response variable, as well as the effects of interactions between factors on the response variable.

label: family history design
definition: A study design in which the family history such as traits, characteristics, susceptibility to disease is studied.

label: genotyping design
definition: A study design that classifies an individual or group of individuals on the basis of alleles, haplotypes, SNPs.

label: hardware testing design
definition: A study design that aims to compare different types of hardware for performance, reproducibility, accuracy and precision.

label: imprinting design
definition: A study design where differences in genetic imprinting of maternally- and paternally-inherited chromosomes (e.g., due to in vivo differences in chemical modification and/or chromatin structure) are compared.

label: in vitro design
definition: A study design that is done in a test tube or a culture dish, e.g. A bacterial invasion assay in an established cell culture.

label: in vivo design
definition: A study design that is conducted entirely in a living organism, e.g. a compound treatment in a mouse model.

label: individual genetic characteristics comparison design
definition: A study design where genotype, haplotype, or other individual genetic characteristics are compared.

label: injury design
definition: A study design in which the response of an organism(s) to injury or damage is studied.

label: innate behavior design
definition: A study design in which the innate behavior of the organism is examined, e.g. path finding in bees.

label: intervention design
definition: An intervention design is a study design in which a controlled process applied to the subjects (the intervention) serves as the independent variable manipulated by the experimentalist. The treatment (perturbation or intervention) defined can be defined as a combination of values taken by independent variable manipulated by the experimentalists are applied to the recruited subjects assigned (possibly by applying specific methods) to treatment groups. The specificity of intervention design is the fact that independent variables are being manipulated and a response of the biological system is evaluated via response variables as monitored by possibly a series of assays.

label: loop design
definition: A loop experiment design is where labeled extracts are compared in consecutive pairs. synonym: circular design

label: matched pairs design
definition: A matched pair design is a study design which use groups of individuals associated (hence matched) to each other based on a set of criteria, one member going to one treatment, the other member receiving the other treatment.

label: microRNA profiling by array design
definition: A study design in which a microRNA array is used to analyse the microRNA component of the transcriptome.

label: normalization testing design
definition: A study design that tests different normalization procedures.

label: observation design
definition: observation design is a study design in which subjects are monitored in the absence of any active intervention by experimentalists.

label: operator variation design
definition: A study design that assesses the operator performance and relation to data consistency and quality.

label: operon identification design
definition: A study design that identifies locations and members of operons in a genome.

label: organism development design
definition: A study design that assays events associated with development. Development applies to organism(s) acquiring a mature state.

label: organism part comparison design
definition: A study design that compares tissues, regions, organs within or between organisms

label: organism status comparison design
definition: A study design that compares samples from live and dead organisms.

label: parallel group design
definition: A parallel group design or independent measure design is a study design which uses unique experimental unit each experimental group, in other word no two individuals are shared between experimental groups, hence also known as parallel group design. Subjects of a treatment group receive a unique combination of independent variable values making up a treatment

label: pathogenicity design
definition: A study design in which an infective agent such as a bacterium, virus, protozoan, fungus etc. infects a host organism(s) and the infective agent is assayed.

label: protein binding site identification design
definition: A study design that investigates protein binding sites on nucleic acids.

label: proteomic profiling by array design
definition: A study design in which proteins in a sample are detected, quantified or otherwise analysed, through an array-based technology.

label: protocol optimization design
definition: A study design where different protocols or protocol parameters are compared aims to find an optimized protocol

label: quality control testing design
definition: A study design in which some aspects of the experiment is quality controlled for the purposes of quality assurance.

label: reference design
definition: A reference experiment design type is where all samples are compared to a common reference.

label: replicate design
definition: A replicate experimental design type is where a series of replicates are performed to evaluate reproducibility or as a pilot study to determine the appropriate number of replicates for a subsequent experiments.

label: self vs self design
definition: A study design that investigates variance and error estimates in the experimental system, and is where the same extract is compared.

label: sex comparison design
definition: A study design that assays differences associated with an organism's sex, gender or mating type.

label: species comparison design
definition: A study design that assays differences between distinct species.

label: strain comparison design
definition: A study design that assays differences between multiple strains, cultivars, serovars, isolates, lines from organisms of a single species.

label: time series design
definition: Groups of assays that are related as part of a time series.

label: transcription profiling by RT-PCR design
definition: A study design which aims to examine the transcriptome of a biological sample by reverse transcription PCR (RT-PCR).

label: transcription profiling by array design
definition: A study design that identifies forms and abundance of transcripts in the genome using microarray technology.

label: transcription profiling by high throughput sequencing design
definition: A study design in which sequencing technology (e.g. Solexa/454) is used to generate RNA sequence, analyse the transcibed regions of the genome, and/or to quantitate transcript abundance

label: transcription profiling by tiling array design
definition: A study design in which gene expression on a genome-wide basis is evaluated, without bias toward coding or noncoding regions, using tiling arrays containing oligonucleotides that are either overlapping or spaced at regular intervals.

label: transcription profiling design
definition: A study design that identifies forms and abundance of transcripts in the genome.

label: translation profiling design
definition: A study design in which surface-bound, translationally competent ribosome complexes are used to generate a translation profile for mRNA, where mRNA may be a single molecular species, or a combination of species, including complex mixtures such as those found in the set of mRNAs isolated from a cell or tissue. One or more components of the surface-bound ribosome complex may be labeled at specific positions to permit analysis of multiple or single molecules for determination of ribosomal conformational changes and translation kinetics. Translation profiles are used as the basis for comparison of an mRNA or set of mRNA species. The translation profile can be used to determine such characteristics as kinetics of initiation, kinetic of elongation, identity of the polypeptide product, and the like. Analysis of translation profiles may be used to determine differential gene expression, optimization of mRNA sequences for expression, screening drug candidates for an effect on translation.

label: translational bias design
definition: A study design that characterizes the association of transcripts and translation machinery.

label: validation by real time PCR design
definition: a study design in which the accuracy or the quality of the result of an assay is checked by comparing with real time PCR results

label: validation by reverse transcription PCR design
definition: a study design in which checks the accuracy or the quality of the result of an assay  by comparing with reverse transcription PCR results

label: cross over design
definition: a repeated measure design which ensures that experimental units receive, in sequence, the treatment (or the control), and then, after a specified time interval (aka *wash-out periods*), switch to the control (or treatment). In this design, subjects (patients in human context) serve as their own controls, and randomization may be used to determine the ordering which a subject receives the treatment and control

label: n-to-1 design
definition: N-of-1 design is a cross-over design in which the same patient is repeatedly randomised to receive either the experimental treatment or its control (Senn, 1993).

label: graeco latin square design
definition: Greco-Latin square design is a study design which relates to Latin square design

label: hyper graeco latin square design
definition: PRS to do

label: latin square design
definition: Latin square design is_a study design which allows in its simpler form controlling 2 levels of nuisance variables (also known as blocking variables).he 2 nuisance factors are divided into a tabular grid with the property that each row and each column receive each treatment exactly once.

label: 2x2 factorial design
definition: a factorial design which has 2 experimental factors (aka independent variables) and 2 factor levels per experimental factors

label: balanced incomplete block design
definition: balanced incomplete block design is a kind of factorial design where all treatment pairs occur together within a block an equal number ?? times. ??ii' is the number of times treatment i occurs with i'

label: fractional factorial design
definition: A fractional factorial design is_a study design in which only an adequately chosen fraction of the treatment combinations required for the complete factorial experiment is selected to be run

label: standard compliance rule
definition: a  standard compliance rule is a compliance rule which defines conformity to a representation standard

label: ethical standard compliance rule
definition: an ethical standard compliance rule is_a *compliance rule* which enable a  *ethical compliance process* to occur

label: exclusion criterion
definition: an exclusion criterion (rule) is_a *eligibility criterion*  which defines and states a condition which, if met, makes an entity unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process. For instance, in a study protocol, exclusion criteria indicate the conditions that prospective subjects SHOULD NOT meet to be eligible for participation in a study

label: inclusion criterion
definition: an inclusion criterion (rule) is_a *eligibility criterion*  which defines and states a condition which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process. For instance, in a study protocol, inclusion criteria indicate the conditions that prospective subjects MUST meet to be eligible for participation in a study.

label: BMI range inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states a Body Mass Index range, which if met, makes an individual suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: age of majority inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that uses the age of majority for a state or institution, where one is generally considered to be an adult, which if met, makes an individual suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: age group inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states an age bracket which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: clinically relevant exposure inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more clinically relevant histories of exposure of an entity, which, if met, makes the entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: clinically relevant lifestyle inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more clinically relevant planned processes that a human being actively participates in , which, if met, makes the human being suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: country of residence inclusion criteria
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more countries of residence which, if met, makes a human being suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: defined population inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that is based on fitting within the defined characteristics of a population based study design.

label: ethnicity inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criteria that defines and states one or more ethnicities which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: family status inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more family statuses, which, if met, makes a human being suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: gravidity inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more gravidity statuses of an organism, which, if met, makes the entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: health status inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more clinically significant bodily components, dispositions, and/or bodily processes of an entity that are inferred from relevant clinical findings or self-reported, which, if met, makes the entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: hospital patient inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion defines that a human being has to be a hospital patient to be suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: sex inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more sexes which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: use of medication inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states a a set of medications, which, if used by an entity, makes that entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: chemotherapy treatment within the recent past exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion that defines whether chemotherapy was received within a certain timeframe, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: radiation treatment within the recent past exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion that defines whether radiation was received within a certain timeframe, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: HIV exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has a history of repeatedly reactive screening assays for HIV-1 or HIV-2 antibody regardless of the results of supplemental assays, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: blood transfusion exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion that is defined by whether the specimen donor received a whole blood transfusion within a specified time frame prior to death, which if met, makes a specimen donor unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: chemotherapy treatment exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion that defines whether chemotherapy was received or is being received for a previous  or current cancer, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process

label: exposure to blood borne infectious disease exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has been exposed to a blood borne infections disease through needle sticks and/or contact with non-intact skin and/or contact with open wounds and/or contact with mucous membranes, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: history of metastatic cancer exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion defined as whether an individual has ever been diagnosed with metastatic cancer (cancer that spread beyond the initial site such as to other organs like brain bone or liver), which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: history of sex with someone with a history of blood borne infection  exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has a history of sex with someone who has been diagnosed or at risk for a blood borne infections disease in a specified time frame, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: history of sex with someone with a history of intravenous drugs exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has a history of sex with someone who has used intravenous drugs in a specified time frame, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: intravenous drug use exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion defined as when an individual has a history of intravenous drug abuse for a specific timeframe, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: radiation treatment exclusion criteria
definition: An exclusion criterion that defines whether radiation was received or is being received for a previous  or current cancer, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process

label: experimental infection of cell culture
definition: is the administration of an infectious agent to a cell culture with the objective to have the agent colonize and replicate in culture

label: lavage
definition: A protocol application to separate cells and/or cellular secretions from an anatomical space by the introduction and removal of fluid

label: animal euthanization
definition: A process in which is the end of life of animal is brought about in accordance with local regulations on treatment of animal subjects and using a method which causes minimal pain and distress to the animal subject

label: cell lysis
definition: cell lysis is a process by which cell membrane integrity of live cells  is compromised and leads to cell death. Cell lysis may be achieved by means of viral action or osmotic shock.

label: intranasal mucosal administration
definition: The administration of a substance into the intranasal mucosis of an organism

label: oral administration
definition: The administration of a substance into the mouth of an organism

label: passive immunization
definition: The injection of immune effector material (antibodies, T cells or B cells) into an organism so that the organisms immune system gains its  immune effector function to recognize specific antigens.

label: pathogen challenge
definition: A pathogen challenge is the administration of a live pathogenic organism to a host

label: vaccination
definition: a process of administering substance in vivo that involves in adding a vaccine into a host (e.g., human) in vivo with the intent to invoke a protective or therapeutic adaptive immune response.

label: administration in vivo with infectious agent
definition: is an administration of an infectious agent to a host organism

label: intraperitoneal administration
definition: The administration of a substance into the peritoneum of an organism

label: information acquisition
definition: An acquisition in which possession of information is gained.

label: material acquisition
definition: An acquisition in which possession of a material entity is gained.

label: acclimatization
definition: A protocol application in which an object is left in an environment for some period of time, until some qualities of interest are in equilibrium with that environment.

label: waiting
definition: not actively doing anything to a material for a duration of time.

label: immunoprecipitation
definition: is a process which realizes a material separation objective by relying on antibodies to specifically binding to material entity

label: isolation of cell population
definition: a process in which a population of cells with certain characteristics is isolated from a larger population

label: DNA Subtraction
definition: a material separation process by which repetitive genomic DNA is removed during the construction of cDNA library.

label: blood harvesting
definition: A material separation where blood is taken from an organism.

label: cell collecting
definition: A planned process that collects cells from culture.

label: cell culture splitting
definition: The act of taking part of a homogeneous cell culture and creating one or more additional separate cultures of similar qualities. input: cell_culture, output cell_culture min cardinality 2. part of cell culturing

label: centrifugation
definition: centrifugation is a process separating molecules by size or density using centrifugal forces generated by a spinning rotor. G-forces of several hundred thousand times gravity are generated in ultracentrifugation

label: concentrate
definition: a protocol application to create an output material with an increased density of a material of interest that is part of the input material by separating other parts of the input material

label: dialysis
definition: a protocol application that uses diffusion through a semi-permeable membrane to separate an input material into two fractions of different composition

label: electrophoresis
definition: a protocol application that uses an electrical potential to move material through a defined matrix in order to separate it by its resistance to movement and its charge

label: excision
definition: the use physical means to remove a portion of a substance from the rest

label: extraction
definition: A material separation in which a desired component of an input material is separated from the remainder

label: filtration
definition: filtration is a process which separates components suspended in a fluid based on granularity properties relying on a filter device

label: gradient separation
definition: a protocol application that uses different concentrations of materials in a defined order to create a gradient to facilitate the separation of an input material into its components with specific qualities

label: isolation of cell culture supernatant
definition: a protocol which results in the separation of supernatant material from a cell culture

label: material portioning
definition: a material processing in which the input substance is partitioned into a number of portions that are similar in composition.

label: organ harvesting
definition: The process of removing an organ from its source organism

label: precipitation
definition: a protocol application to cause a material to precipitate (becoming a solid) out of solution. Input is a solution, output is a solution plus a solid component (the precipitate)

label: preparative chromatography
definition: the use of a biomaterial's preferential affinity for either the mobile phase or the stationary phase to separate it from other materials of differing affinity

label: purification
definition: A planned process to separate a material entity into different compositions of which one or more have are purified fractions that contain higher concentration of a desired component, while others contain impurities and are not of interest

label: group randomization
definition: A group assignment which relies on chance to assign materials to a group of materials in order to avoid bias in experimental set up.

label: carboxyfluorescein succinimidyl ester staining assay
definition: a assay detecting a molecular label assay where the amount of carboxyfluorescein succinimidyl ester is measured using fluorescence detection.

label: immuno staining assay
definition: A assay detecting a molecular label assay in which the label is attached to an antibody so that substances are marked based on the antibody's binding specificity.

label: histopathology assay
definition: A histological assay that is intended to check for the presence or level of a specific disease.

label: electroporation
definition: a process in which a significant increase in the electrical conductivity and permeability of the cell plasma membrane caused by an externally applied electrical field. It is usually used in molecular biology as a way of introducing some substance into a cell, such as loading it with a molecular probe, a drug that can change the cell's function, or a piece of coding DNA

label: establishing cell line
definition: a process whereby a new type of cell line is created, either through passaging of a primary cell culture to relative genetic stability and compositional homogeneity, or through some experimental modification of an existing cell line to produce a new line with novel characteristics  (e.g. immortalization or some other stable genetic modification, or selection of some defined subset).

label: establishing primary cell culture
definition: an establishing cell culture process whereby cells explanted directly from an organismal source or specimen, and placed in culture for maintenance or propagation as a primary cell culture

label: random primed DNA labeling
definition: a labeling in which random primers are used to uniformly label input DNA

label: non-specific labeling
definition: The addition of a reagent labeling the entire input biomaterial enabling future detection of the output biomaterial

label: specific labeling
definition: a labeling in which the labeling reagent used  has a specificity to bind only certain components of the input material

label: immortalizing cell line transformation
definition: a genetic transformation of a cell line cell with transgenic constructs intended to confer the capability for indefinite propagation in culture

label: DNA transduction
definition: a genetic transformation which relies on the use of lysogenic infection to transfer DNA sequences into an organism

label: chromosomal substitution
definition: A genetic transformation in which all, or part, of a chromosome from a donor replaces that of the recipient. It does not include chromosome recombination. For single gene insertion, use the term 'gene knock in'.

label: gene knock in
definition: a genetic transformation that involves the insertion of a protein coding cDNA sequence at a particular locus in an organism's chromosome. Typically, this is done in mice since the technology for this process is more refined, and because mouse embryonic stem cells are easily manipulated. The difference between knock-in technology and transgenic technology is that a knock-in involves a gene inserted into a specific locus, and is a "targeted" insertion.

label: gene knock out
definition: a genetic transformation that renders a gene non-functional, e.g. due to a point mutation, or the removal of all, or part of, the gene using recombinant methods.

label: induced mutation
definition: a genetic transformation that the modification of the genetic material (either coding or non-coding) of an organism is caused by mutagenic compounds or irradiation.

label: transfection
definition: a genetic transformation which relies on the use of physical, electrical and chemical phenomena to introduce DNA or RNA into a cell

label: 3D structure determination of bound complex assay
definition: A 3D structure determination assay in which a complex of 2 or more material enties is characterized which provides information on their binding configuration.

label: 3D structure determining assay of a 3D B cell epitope:antibody complex
definition: A B cell epitope recognition assay that characterizes the 3D structure of an antibody / BCR with a ligand.

label: 3D structure determining assay of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
definition: A T cell epitope recognition assay that uses a 3D structure determination of bound complex assay.

label: X-ray crystallography assay
definition: A 3D structure determination assay in which the diffraction of pattern of X-ray beams in a crystal of purified material entities is used to resolve the 3-dimensional structure of the material entity of interest.

label: nuclear magnetic resonance 3D structure determination assay
definition: A 3D structure determination assay that uses magnetic properties of atomic nuclei to determine the 3D structure and dynamics of molecules in the input sample.

label: small-angle scattering assay
definition: A 3D structure determination assay in which the scattering pattern of a neutron or x-ray beam targeted at a material entity is recorded at small angles relative to the incident beam to determine the size, shape and structure of the material entity examined.

label: DNA replication timing by sequencing assay
definition: An assay in which timing of DNA replication is quantified as a function of genome position based on genome-wide sequencing.

label: DNA sequencing assay
definition: A sequencing assay which determines information on the sequence of a DNA molecule.

label: Edman degradation
definition: A sequencing assay in which the amino acid sequence of input peptides or proteins is determined by iteratively cleaving of the amino-terminal (N-terminal) residue without disrupting the peptide bonds and identifying it by e.g. chromatography or electropheresis.

label: RNA sequencing assay
definition: An assay that determines the sequence of an RNA molecule.

label: protein sequencing by tandem mass spectrometry assay
definition: A sequencing assay that detremines amino acid sequences of proteins using multiple rounds of mass spectrometry and molecule fragmentation.

label: taxonomic diversity assessment by targeted gene survey
definition: An assay that dteremines taxonomic and community diversity information by sequencing specific genomic regions used as marker of identity or diversity.
alternative_term: targeted gene survey|targeted gene survey DNA barcoding|environmental gene survey

label: transcript analysis by single-end sequencing assay
definition: A sequencing assay that incorporates single-end reads and sequencing technology to determine transcripts, gene structures, and gene expressions.

label: trypsination
definition: trypsination is a protease cleavage which uses enzyme trypsin to act on proteins present in an input material entity

label: reverse transcribed polymerase chain reaction
definition: reverse transcribe pcr is a process which allow amplification of cDNA during a pcr reaction while the cDNA results from a retrotranscription of messenger RNA isolated from a material entity.

label: DNA polymerase amplification
definition: DNA polymerase amplification is an enzymatic amplification which uses DNA polymerase enzyme to make copies of a DNA contained in biomaterial used as input

label: enzymatic DNA replication
definition: the use of enzymes to duplicate DNA molecule any process used to make additional copies of a biomaterial

label: linear amplification
definition: An enzymatic amplification which amplifies nucleic acid sequence by making many copies off the same template.

label: polymerase chain reaction
definition: PCR is the process in which a DNA polymerase is used to amplify a piece of DNA by in vitro enzymatic replication. As PCR progresses, the DNA thus generated is itself used as a template for replication. This sets in motion a chain reaction in which the DNA template is exponentially amplified.

label: nucleotide overhang cloning
definition: Nucleotide overhang cloning is the process of inserting nucleic acid into a vector using nucleotide overhangs used to prevent self ligation

label: recombinant BAC cloning
definition: Recombinant BAC cloning is a  process with the objective to insert genetic material into an F plasmid based bacterial artificial chromosome for future replication of the inserted material

label: recombinant YAC cloning
definition: Recombinant YAC cloning is a  process with the objective to insert genetic material into a yeast artificial chromosome vector for future replication of the inserted material

label: recombinant phage cloning
definition: Recombinant phage cloning is the process of using a phage plus some insert nucleic acid for the purposes of amplification of the insert material achieved by phage assembly in vitro.

label: recombination enzyme based cloning
definition: a recombination enzyme based cloning is a recombinant vector cloning process that uses complementary nucleotide sequences in both the insert genetic material and the cloning vector with a recombination enzyme to directly create a recombinant vector

label: restriction enzyme based cloning
definition: restriction enzyme based cloning is a recombinant vector cloning process that has as an input genetic material that was cleaved with restriction enzymes, and a cloning vector that was cleaved with complementary restriction enzymes. It uses ligase to chemically join the input genetic material and the cloning vector to create a recombinant vector.

label: recombinant plasmid cloning
definition: the insertion of a particular DNA fragment into a plasmid in order to make copies of a biomaterial

label: vector mediated amplification
definition: The process of creating a copy of some biological entity in cell culture

label: vector mediated expression
definition: vector mediated expression sis the generation of copies of biomaterial by in a cell_culture modified for this purpose by insertion of an expression vector

label: RNA extraction with polyA depletion
definition: A RNA extraction process in which only RNAs lacking a polyA tail are retained

label: cytoplasmic RNA extraction
definition: A RNA extraction process in which the desired output material is RNA in the cytoplasm.

label: nuclear RNA extraction
definition: A RNA extraction process in which the desired output material is RNA in the nucleus.

label: organellar RNA extraction
definition: A RNA extraction process in which the desired output material is RNA in the organelle(s).

label: polyA RNA extraction
definition: A RNA extraction process typically involving the use of poly dT oligomers in which the desired output material is polyA RNA.

label: total RNA extraction
definition: A RNA extraction process in which total cellular and organelle RNA are extracted.

label: viral RNA extraction
definition: The extraction of RNA from an input material that specifically isolates viral RNA

label: DNA extraction
definition: A DNA extraction is a nucleic acid extraction where the desired output material is DNA.

label: RNA extraction
definition: A RNA extraction is a nucleic acid extraction where the desired output material is RNA

label: Individual epitope immunization in vivo
definition: An immunization in which an individual epitope is administered into a host organism.

label: effector T cell function
definition: The function inhering in a T cell that is realized in an immune response that results from the T cell receptor binding to the MHC:epitope complex.

label: B cell receptor complex
definition: An immunoglobulin complex that is present in the plasma membrane of B cells and that in its canonical form is composed of two identical immunoglobulin heavy chains and two identical immunoglobulin light chains and a signaling subunit, a heterodimer of the Ig-alpha and Ig-beta proteins.

label: T cell receptor complex
definition: A protein complex that contains a disulfide-linked heterodimer of T cell receptor (TCR) chains, which are members of the immunoglobulin superfamily, and mediates antigen recognition, ultimately resulting in T cell activation. The TCR heterodimer is associated with the CD3 complex, which consists of the nonpolymorphic polypeptides gamma, delta, epsilon, zeta, and, in some cases, eta (an RNA splice variant of zeta) or Fc epsilon chains.

label: assay measuring T cell epitope specific biological activity
definition: A T cell epitope recognition assay that detects biological activity.

label: assay measuring a binding constant of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
definition: A T cell epitope recognition assay that quantitavely characterizes the binding of a TCR with a ligand by determining a binding constant.

label: assay measuring qualitiative binding of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
definition: A T cell epitope recognition assay that qualitatively detects MHC:epitope complex binding to TCR.

label: cultured CD4-/CD8- T cell population
definition: A T cell population characterized by not expressing the CD4 nor the CD8 molecule on its surface.
alternative_term: CD4-/CD8- T cell culture sample|CD4-/CD8- T cell culture sample

label: immunologic adjuvant role
definition: The role a material entity plays when it is co-administered with an immunogen in order to enhance the immune response to the immunogen.

label: Immunization in vivo
definition: Process of administering an object playing the role of immunogen to a living organism

label: contact to pathogen carrying biological vector
definition: a process in which a vector carrying an infectious agent comes close enough to a potential host organism that a contact can result

label: living in endemic area
definition: a process in which a potential host organism lives in a geographic area in which an infectious agent is present to such a degree of frequency that contact is likely

label: living with infected household contact
definition: a process in which a a human being lives in the same household as another human being that is known to be infected with an infectious agent

label: pathogen release in laboratory accident
definition: a process in which a an infectious agent maintained in a laboratory setting is not contained as planned, leading to potential exposure of human beings to the agent

label: allergic reaction
definition: an allergic reaction is an pathologic immune response by an organism to a non-self entity that is normally harmless(the allergen)

label: infection process
definition: the detrimental process in which an infectious agent colonizes or replicates in a host environment

label: flow cytometry assay measuring cell-cell binding of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
definition: A T cell epitope qualitative binding assay that uses a cell-cell binding detection by flow cytometry assay.

label: Edman degradation assay measuring MHC ligand processing and presentation
definition: A MHC ligand processing and presentation assay that uses Edman degradation to identify the eluted ligands

label: coelution assay measuring MHC ligand processing and presentation using T cell recognition of HPLC fractionated eluate compared to synthetic ligand
definition: A MHC ligand processing and presentation assay in which an HPL chromatography is run to separate an input mixture of ligands eluted from MHC into fractions. These fractions are tested for recognition by T cells and compared to the recognition of a synthetic ligand that is presumed to be the recognized epitope. Identical HPLC fractionation and T cell recognition patterns confirm that the specific ligand was presented by MHC molecules.

label: mass spectrometry assay measuring MHC ligand processing and presentation
definition: A MHC ligand processing and presentation assay that uses a mass spectrometry assay to identify eluted ligands

label: monospecific T cell recognition assay measuring MHC ligand processing and presentation
definition: A MHC ligand processing and presentation assay in which the presence of a specific ligand in an eluate is detected using the response of T cells that are known to be monospecific for that ligand as a readout.

label: assay measuring a binding constant of a MHC:ligand complex
definition: A MHC:ligand binding assay that measures a binding constant.

label: assay measuring qualitiative binding of a MHC:ligand complex
definition: A MHC:ligand binding assay that detects qualitative binding.

label: assay measuring B cell epitope specific biological activity
definition: A B cell epitope recognition assay that detects biological activity.

label: assay measuring a binding constant of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
definition: A B cell epitope recognition assay that quantitavely characterizes the binding of an antibody / BCR with a ligand by determining a binding constant.

label: assay measuring qualitiative binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
definition: A B cell epitope recognition assay that detects qualitative binding.

label: MHC ligand assay
definition: An immune epitope assay that detects either the processing and presentation of a ligand by an antigen presenting cell or the binding of a ligand to an MHC molecule.

label: assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
definition: An immune epitope assay that detects B cell epitope recognition.

label: assay measuring binding of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
definition: An immune epitope assay that detects T cell epitope recognition.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific IP-10 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects IP-10 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific RANTES production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects RANTES production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects production of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects production of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 19 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 19 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 21 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 21 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 12 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 12 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific granulocyte macrophage colony stimulating factor production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects granulocyte macrophage colony stimulating factor production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interferon-alpha production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interferon-alpha production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interferon-beta production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interferon-beta production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interferon-gamma production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interferon-gamma production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-1 beta production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-1 beta production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-10 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-10 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-12 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-12 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-13 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-13 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-15 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-15 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-16 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-16 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-17 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-17 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-18 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-18 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-2 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-2 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-21 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-21 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-22 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-22 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-23 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-23 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-27 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-27 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-3 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-3 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-4 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-4 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-5 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-5 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-6 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-6 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-7 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-7 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-8 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-8 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific oncostatin M production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects oncostatin M production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific transforming growth factor-beta production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects transforming growth factor-beta production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific vascular endothelial growth factor production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects vascular endothelial growth factor production by T cells.

label: biological activity assay measuring interleukin-9 production by T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-9 production by T cells.

label: in vitro assay measuring epitope specific T cell killing
definition: A T cell epitope specific killing assay that uses an in vitro cell killing assay.

label: in vivo assay measuring epitope specific T cell killing
definition: A T cell epitope specific killing assay that uses an in vivo cell mediated cell killing assay.

label: in vitro assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay that is performed on cells in vitro.

label: in vivo assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells
definition: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay that is performed in vivo.

label: clinical history devoid of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there was no diagnosis of cancer.

label: clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer.

label: clinical history of repeated HIV assays
definition: A clinical history in which there is repeated reactive screening assays for human immunodeficiency virus (1 or 2) antibodies regardless of the results of supplemental assays.

label: exposure to second hand smoke
definition: A clinical history in which there has been second hand exposure to tobacco smoking.

label: family clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a blood relative.

label: gynecologic surgery history
definition: A clinical history in which a woman has had gynecologic surgery in the past.

label: hormonal replacement therapy history
definition: A clinical history in which an individual has had hormonal replacement therapy in the past.

label: pregnancy history
definition: A clinical history in which a female has had a pregnancy.

label: unknown clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which it is not known whether there was a diagnosis of cancer.

label: allergy
definition: is a disease in which an abnormally strong inflammatory immune response is triggered against non-self entities, and the immune response has no protective effect

label: autoimmune disease
definition: Is a disease characterized by an immune response of an organism against parts of itself

label: cancer
definition: A disease characterized by abnormal and uncontrolled cell division

label: infectious disease
definition: is a disease caused by an infectious agent

label: occurrence of allergy
definition: The process of an allergic disease occurring in an organism.

label: occurrence of infectious disease
definition: Is an occurrence of a disease caused by an infection

label: diagnosis of cancer
definition: A diagnosis that is an assertion that a patient who is the subject of a diagnostic process has cancer.

label: diagnosis of infectious disease
definition: A diagnosis that is an assertion that a patient who is the subject of a diagnostic process has an infectious disease.

label: fixed tissue slide specimen
definition: A fixed tissue specimen that is placed in a slide.

label: H&E-stained fixed tissue slide specimen
definition: A fixed tissue slide specimen that is the output of H&E slide staining.

label: IHC-stained fixed tissue slide specimen
definition: A fixed tissue slide specimen that is the output of immunohistochemistry slide staining.

label: F mating type
definition: A bacterial mating type indicating the presence of F plasmid in a bacterial cell.

label: F minus mating type
definition: A bacterial mating type indicating the absence of F plasmid in a bacterial cell.

label: a mating type (yeast)
definition: A S. cerevisiae mating type cells that secrete a pheromone that in alpha haploids stimulates processes that lead to mating.

label: alpha mating type (yeast)
definition: A S. cerevisiae mating type cells that secrete a pheromone that stimulates a haploids.

label: female
definition: A biological sex quality inhering in an individual or a population that only produces gametes that can be fertilised by male gametes.

label: h minus
definition: A S. pombe mating type determined by the mat1-Mc and mat1-Mi on the mat1 locus.

label: h plus
definition: A S. pombe mating type determined by the mat1-Pc and mat1-Pi on the mat1 locus.

label: hermaphrodite
definition: A biological sex quality inhering in an organism or a population with both male and female sexual organs in one individual.

label: male
definition: A biological sex quality inhering in an individual or a population whose sex organs contain only male gametes.

label: handedness
definition: A behavioral quality inhering ina bearer by virtue of the bearer's unequal distribution of fine motor skill between its left and right hands or feet.

label: DNA residue methylation
definition: a quality of a DNA residue that has a methyl group attached to it

label: age
definition: A time quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of how long the bearer has existed.

label: alive
definition: A viability quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's condition before death.

label: behavioral quality
definition: An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's behavior aggregate of the responses or reactions or movements in a given situation.

label: biomaterial purity
definition: A composition quality inhering in an bearer by virtue of the bearer's homogeneity of a biomaterial.

label: cellular quality
definition: A monadic quality of continuant that exists at the cellular level of organisation.

label: circular
definition: A quality of a nucleotide polymer that has no terminal nucleotide residues.

label: damaged
definition: A structural quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer being harmed or injured or spoiled, such that its functionality is impaired.

label: dead
definition: A viability quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the cessation of the bearer's life.

label: fluid flow rate
definition: A physical quality inhering in a fluid (liquid or gas) by virtue of the amount of fluid which passes through a given surface per unit time.

label: frozen
definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being kept below its freezing point.

label: pressure
definition: A physical quality that inheres in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's amount of force per unit area it exerts.

label: quality of a gas
definition: A physical quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's exhibiting the physical characteristics of an entity consisting of particles that have neither a defined volume nor defined shape.

label: quality of a liquid
definition: A physical quality inhering in an entity exhibiting the physical characteristics of an amorphous (non-crystalline) form of matter between a gas and a solid that has a definite volume, but no definite shape.

label: quality of a solid
